position title: program manager, institutional and international programs


department: office of the principal, glendon college


affiliation: cpm


salary grade: f


hiring salary range: $81,985 - $92,233


maximum of salary range: $112,729


duration: contract full-time  


hours: 8:30 am - 4:30 pm


position start date: june 6, 2017   position end date: april 30, 2018


 


purpose:
please 
note: there are 4 contract positions available. 
please note: this position 
requires bilingualism in english and french, and is located at glendon college: 
2275 bayview avenue, toronto. 

the program managers play a key 
role in supporting the executive director of government, institutional and 
international relations (giir) with the implementation of several local, provincial, 
national and international initiatives. two program managers will report to the 
director, strategic partnerships and two program managers will report to the  
executive director, giir. program managers will manage the day-to-
day implementation of a variety of complex projects to achieve objectives that are 
strategically aligned with the expansion of french-language programs and 
services on the glendon campus. they liaise with institutional and community 
partners, conduct institutional research, build business cases for new programs. 
assists the director of strategic partnerships to develop project and funding 
proposals, develop operational frameworks for new institutional partnerships (at 
the local, provincial, national and international levels), and manage all aspects of 
project implementation and program delivery. project managers will be assigned 
specific portfolios and a variety of projects, taking them from conception to 
successful implementation. they will be responsible for developing project 
implementation plan, developing and managing operational budgets, liaising with 
colleagues across the university and the post-secondary education sector. each 
project manager will manage a portfolio of institutional initiatives, at various stages 
of development, involving a variety of stakeholders that may generate over 
$2,000,000 in revenue for the glendon campus.


 


education:
university undergraduate degree in a relevant field (such as a business admin. , 
political science, finance or education) or an acceptable equivalent combination of 
education and at least three years’ experience in policy development, international 
education, community development  programs, or project management.


 


experience:
minimum of two years previous exposure to decision-making processes and project 
management, preferably in a postsecondary education environment. some 
supervisory experience required. demonstrated ability to work effectively with a broad 
range of stakeholders, and particularly with  french-language community in a minority 
setting.


 


skills:
the candidate should demonstrate competence in the following areas: 

initiative: demonstrate creativity and initiative to suggest improvements and encourage positive results. be proactive and self-starting. show 
availability and is willing to go above and beyond whenever it is possible.
adaptability: demonstrate a willingness to be flexible, versatile and/or tolerant in a multi-institutional and multi-stakeholder work environment while 
maintaining effectiveness and efficiency. 
communication: speak, listen and write in a clear, thorough and timely manner using appropriate and effective communication tools and techniques 
and superior oral and written professional communication skills in french and english.  impeccable attention to detail is a must.
administration and organization: ability to prioritize, develop a work schedule and meet deadlines; effective at monitoring and evaluating progress 
towards goals and tracking details, data, information and activities. 
stakeholder needs: anticipate, understand, and respond to the needs of a multi-disciplinary group of internal and external stakeholders, including 
professors, researchers, students, project partners; willingness to meet or exceed their expectations within the organizational parameters. 
teamwork: work cooperatively and effectively with others to set goals, resolve problems, and make decisions that enhance organizational 
effectiveness; accept and give constructive feedback; be willing to take direction when required.

required skills 
project management:
knowledge of the principles of project management, particularly as they relate to the coordination of multi-institutional projects. 
knowledge of the french-language education policy framework (i.e. pal – politique d’aménagement linguistique)
expertise in the preparation of reports and the development of project proposals. 
ability to facilitate collaboration and engagement. 
ability to work within and negotiate complex institutional environments, specifically university and not-for-profit environments. 
willingness to take direction. 

accounting and financial management:
proven financial management skills, including the ability to create and monitor project and operating budgets. 

communications, knowledge mobilization and public relations:
good judgment; exercises tact and diplomacy. 
ability to maintain confidentiality. 
detail oriented; attentiveness to detail is a must. 
superior oral and written professional communication skills in french and english. 
proficient social media and web analytics skills. 
ability to draft press releases and other public communications materials. 
proficient in the use ms office (word, excel, power point), and multi-media editing suites. 
experience in the design and execution of professional communication strategies, including proficiency in the use of social media.

additional skills and experience:
business development experience would be an asset
experience in developing and maintaining successful community partnerships
knowledge of and experience with local non-profit community organizations would be an asset
a demonstrated commitment to customer service, strong interpersonal skills 
excellent organizational and time management skills and strong ability to multi-task and prioritize responsibilities
excellent negotiation and problem-solving skills, attention to detail
strong analytical skills to compile and analyze information and data for program planning 
ability to work independently with minimum supervision, ability to work successfully in a team setting experience with knowledge mobilization and with 
database


 


cover letter required: yes 


 


dates:
 

internal posting date: june 5, 2017


internal application deadline: posted until filled 

 

extended posting date: june 5, 2017 


extended application deadline: posted until filled 

 

external posting date: june 5, 2017 


external application deadline: posted until filled 




please note: all applications must be received by 4:30 p.m. on the posted deadline date.

title: Analyst/Senior Analyst, Product and Perception of Coverage M...
text:
job description - analyst/senior analyst, product and perception of coverage marketing (17011755)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|all jobsbeginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - analyst/senior analyst, product and perception of coverage marketing (17011755)job description analyst/senior analyst, product and perception of coverage marketing-17011755description american express canada is a company with a long history and a bright future. a canadian employer since 1853, amex has created a culture that nurtures extraordinary talent and turns careers into unparalleled experiences. a company where every employee is given the opportunity to learn, grow and excel, amex is always on the lookout for driven, forward-thinking and creative people ready to take their career to the next level. so, if you share our passion for excellence, our dedication to great service and our excitement about innovation, there’s a world of opportunity waiting for you in a career with american express canada.
 
global merchant services marketing is dedicated to bringing buyers and sellers together and transforming how american express is welcomed. gms marketing is responsible for partnering with gms markets to drive profitable growth, accelerate coverage and enhance the value of amex acceptance to merchants and card members at scale. we focus on enhancing our relationships with millions of merchants of all shapes and sizes, and our geographic purview includes many commerce hubs across the globe including the u.s, canada, latin america, the caribbean, europe and the asia-pacific region. 
it is also critical for gms marketing to collaborate effectively with card issuing teams and other sister organizations across the blue box in order to fully harness the power of the closed loop via mediums including custom consulting, offers, recommendations, multi-merchant campaigns, digital experiences and brand awareness. gms marketing partners with organizations including client management, marketing operations, information management, enterprise digital, web experience, global advertising and brand management and global servicing network.
the role 
with the launch and expansion of the optblue program, our merchant coverage has started to expand nationwide, and it is a critical blue box priority to ensure card members and card member prospects are aware that you can use your american express card in more places than ever.
the successful candidate will be responsible for the development, execution, and ongoing management of perception of coverage related products and programs that drive incremental value to american express merchants. 
the successful candidate will bring a strong customer first mindset along with a proven ability to collaborate and drive results among a diverse stakeholder group (amex issuing partners, international gms partners, central product teams, and external agencies).  
key responsibilities 
product & campaign management: 
•      ownership of overall experience and merchant eligibility of amex map assets to increase web traffic and engagement on the map 
•      ownership of coverage claim assets and management/creation of data driven insights
•      develop and execute marketing campaigns to drive merchant and cm activations through cm recommendations capabilities. 
•      ownership of overall experience of the point of purchase (pop) program including customer journey optimization, product development, and inventory management. 
 
relationship management: 
•      build partnerships with gms central teams, both international and u.s. markets to leverage best practices and project manage market capability launches 
•      build partnerships with issuers to drive channel optimization & adoption of poc assets. 
•      partner with client management teams to create custom pop programs with prioritized merchants. 
•      liaise/collaborate with external agencies/ vendors to brief and oversee marketing campaigns and inventory management. 
 
strategy & data analytics: 
•      understand & analyze big data to create insights that drive and inform coverage marketing strategies and campaigns 
•      develop regular reports measuring and analyzing the performance of key business metrics, and recommend and implement strategic actions and solutions
•      understand customer and competitive trends by completing periodic competitive and qualitative assessments and providing commentary on findings
 
offer of employment with american express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.qualifications 

university degree or equivalent combination of education and business experience.

2-3 years marketing experience in financial services or similar industry.  
§  strong analytical skills and proven ability to conduct analysis to support business initiatives and sound recommendations
 
§  strong customer focus and ability to analyze customer experience processes and insights to inform strategies
 
§  high energy, proactive and able to work well under pressure with competing priorities
 
§  proven collaborator with excellent communication skills with the ability to influence a range of stakeholders. 
 
§  excellent project management skills to manage multiple ongoing projects across various teams
 
§  attention to detail and process-oriented is essential

it’s an exciting time to join american express canada, where we dedicate extensive time, resources and effort to satisfying and surprising our customers. we make that same commitment to our employees, as well, striving to create an environment where people are respected, both personally and professionally. be part of it. american express canada is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, members of visible minority groups and women.  if you have a disability accommodations can be made. 
 
 job marketingprimary location canada-ontario-torontoschedule full-timejob posting sep 21, 2017, 9:05:45 am - oct 5, 2017, 10:59:00 pm   american express is an equal opportunity employer. contact us at global.recruiting@aexp.comadchoicesprivacy statementterms of serviceamerican express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other status protected by law.us candidates/employees: click here to view the "eeo is the law" poster and supplement and the pay transparency policy statement.all users of our online services subject to privacy statement and agree to be bound by terms of service. please review.© 2015 american express company. all rights reserved.

title: 
                        
artificial intelligence research analyst
                        









 

requisition id: 8070
join the global community of scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
purpose of job:
data science & analytics team has developed sophisticated distributed infrastructure to provide management and sales staff key insights for decision making. the team consists of accomplished professionals and highly motivated recent graduates who blend business, modeling, and computer science expertise to solve complex problems.
 
at this time, we are seeking a high performance, enthusiastic individual with research experience in artificial intelligence to be part of the team. they will develop advanced ai and cognitive models to improve operations of bank's treasury department. the successful candidate will report to dsa head of modelling.
 
key job accountabilities:  

use your artificial intelligence and machine learning expertise to build next-generation customer behaviour models for various lending and deposit products
leverage large amounts of historical data to model optimization of financial resources
collaborate with academic partners in canada and usa on fundamental and applied research in the field of artificial intelligence
publish their in work academic papers and present it at conferences where the work constitutes significant breakthroughs

 
skills, experiences and functional competencies:
the position requires research expertise in one of more of the following areas of artificial intelligence or cognitive science:

deep learning (recurrent and convolutional neural nets)
reinforcement learning (markov decision processes, q-learning)
natural language processing (information retrieval, knowledge representation
graphical models

we do not require expertise or experience in financial industry. on the job training will be provided.
 
education and other requirements:
strongly preferred ph.d. in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, statistics, neuroscience, physics or another stem discipline. relevant research experience is essential.
 
 
 
 
location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. we are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

performance analyst - digital marketing & insights - mar04315-17description position overview:   as the senior performance analyst on the digital marketing & insights team, you will play a key role in driving insights to maximize investment opportunities and strategy for telus digital marketing activities.   candidates for the role will be curious to understand the ‘why’ behind the data and are excited about the opportunity data provides in creating best in class digital marketing programs for telus. you will work with both internal and external partners to find insights in order to optimize our digital marketing spend.   candidates will lead the strategy to evolve telus’s digital marketing measurement and attribution to a best in class model.   our team is known within telus as a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment that is an agent of change and a great place to learn and grow. we have a culture of collaboration, recognition, and high-performance. simply put, if you're bright, ambitious and looking for a challenge, this is the place to be.   responsibilities:  lead analytics projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysis work with agency and partner teams to define kpi’s and develop tracking/tagging strategies to allow for the kpi’s success to be measured manage regular reporting, scorecards, and dashboards (weekly, monthly, quarterly and ad-hoc requests) leverage data to tell the story of how digital marketing is achieving outcomes design, build and maintain financial models to connect initiatives/activity with kpi’s & outcomes for the channel or campaign champion, coach and mentor team members on best practices in program analytics proactively identify opportunities to constantly improve our digital campaign measurement evolve telus digital measurement from “last click” to a weighted multi-touch attribution model qualifications required knowledge:  passionate about how data can be used to solve business problems strong presentation skills with the ability to tell stories with data, and ability to influence and persuade executive stakeholders and working team members a flexible approach and the ability to accept and champion change highly organized with a demonstrated ability to monitor and manage high volume workloads creative and innovative thinker a bias for action  required skills & abilities:  advanced microsoft office package (especially ms excel) adobe analytics (report builder, segments, adhocs) google analytics facebook report builder doubleclick campaign manager sql experience with adobe audience manager is a plus  required professional designation/certification:  post-secondary degree in marketing or business mba (or equivalent experience) would be an asset  required experience:  5+ years digital analytics experience preferable to have digital experience in a telco along with analytics tools: domo, tableau, qualtrics, sql, adobe, google analytics, adwords  who is telus?    we're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make telus one of the leading telecommunications companies in canada. our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and optik tv™. we also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.   everyone belongs at telus. it doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at telus, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.   do you share our passion?       at telus, you create future friendly® possibilities.   at telus, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. primary location: ca-on-torontoschedule: full-timeaccessibilitytelus is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. we are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

title: Data Analyst
text:
vision7 international data analyst | smartrecruiters

data analysttoronto, canadafull-timecompany descriptioncossette is a dynamic canadian marketing communications agency. we have been around for more than 40 years. we have offices in all regions of the country and although we are considered part of the canadian agency establishment, we’re anything but stuffy. in fact, we are the exact opposite. cossette has a reputation for being innovative and entrepreneurial. we pride ourselves in our agility,creativity,our currency and a certain kind of edginess. we play hard and we work hard. perhaps that’s why we previously were named one of the best 50 employers in the country. at least that’s what we think. but you don’t need to take our word for it. come and learn for yourself.job descriptionwe are looking for a bright individual who loves data and analytics, is a master of excel, can use sql and is familiar with big data architecture.  this person will be critical in supporting the media team with reporting, process improvement and building database solutions for our clients.responsibilities·       analyzing and preparing media reports for clients·       work to build and populate client dashboards by using the internal data infrastructure·       use web analytic tools such as adobe analytics or google analytics to provide insights on performance of digital campaigns·       utilize and interpret in-house and online research tools (comscore, vizu, nielsen, etc.)·       effectively perform analysis of various types of digital media packages and digital media opportunities·       collaboratively work to analyze and develop cross-platform media opportunities that include digital media elements·       possess a strong working knowledge of microsoft outlook, word, excel (including pivot tables) and powerpointqualifications·       have a passion for big data technologies and a flexible, creative approach to problem solving.·       excellent problem solving and programming skills; proven technical leadership and communication skills·       proficiency with data visualization tools such as bime or tableau·       familiarity with google cloud platform preferred (cloud storage, google bigquery)·       experience designing, coding and maintaining sql database ·       website, conversion and viewability tracking experience is a plus (ga, adobe analytics, moat)·       ad serving experience or knowledge is a plus (dcm, adgear)·       proactive and eager to present new ideas·       very strong math skills·       very active and engaged user of digital media·       proficient in excel, powerpoint·       must have a university educational background additional informationwe thank all applicants. however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.cossette media is an equal opportunity employer. it prohibits discrimination based on age, color, disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other legally protected class in accordance with applicable federal, provincial and local laws. cossette media is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace. if you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.i'm interestedi'm interestedrefer a friendshare this jobother jobs at vision7 internationalsuperviseur(e) médiamontreal, canadaexpert seo / semmontreal, canadaplanificateur (trice) médiamontreal, canadashow all jobspowered bydata analysttoronto, canadafull-timei'm interested

wwqa - analytics - burnaby - british columbia - canada - americas   job description print preview apply save job email job to friend return to list   the challenge ahead: as a data analyst within cds analytics team you will play a key role in analyzing our operational data to improve our quality verification strategies. you should be a sharp, curious, and analytic individual who has a passion for diving into data to solve business problems. your insights will influence how we build and verify the quality of ours games.   what a data analyst does at ea: receives questions from your game team, understands the questions, and determines the data needed to answer them. assembles data from multiple sources, conducts analyses, performs research, designs, documents and implements analytical solutions.     presents analysis conclusions to the game team in a clear, understandable, and valuable way. tells compelling stories supported by data! takes responsibility and ownership for their active projects, always looking for new problems to solve and new concepts to implement. communicates clearly (and as often as needed) with team members and business stakeholders. builds strong relationships across the data analyst community, to share knowledge and learn from others. presents high quality reports and findings in power bi or as presentations. builds metrics reporting systems and tracks process improvements across the team. conduct analysis using statistical software, databases, spreadsheets, and reporting tools design, evaluate and monitor key metrics, understanding root causes of changes in metrics develop and maintain scripts and queries to import, manipulate, clean, transform data from different sources build and share live dashboards and reports complete with user documentation perform quality assurance on generated results to ensure accuracy and consistency   the next great data analyst needs: 2-3 years in a past analytical role. data analysis - very good knowledge of r language, ms excel mastery, including vba, pivottables, and array functions - or other similar tools used for discovering data patterns and correlations through statistical methods. university degree in a technical field (e.g. computer science, statistics, engineering, mathematics, operations research, etc.) very good math and analytical skills including statistics, simulation, and optimization - understanding of correlation, regression, classification and other statistical methods used to look at the data from different angles for use in prescriptive and predictive models. expert data visualization techniques for charts and reports - good knowledge of microsoft power bi and/or tableau. must have very good database and sql knowledge. strong problem solving and creative thinking skills. ability to start and maintain strong partnerships between valuable customers. professionalism in working with clients and working in a team environment.       apply save job email job full-time






toronto, on, canada











thescore’s mission is to create highly-engaging digital products and content that empower the sports fan’s experience. its flagship mobile app ‘thescore’ is one of the most popular multi-sport news and data apps in north america, serving millions of fans a month. the company also creates innovative digital sports experiences through its web, social and esports platforms.
as a part of the data analytics team, you will be a part of a team where data, measurement, and analysis is integral to smart decision making and building awesome products and features. the ideal candidate has a passion for data, a strong background in quantitative analysis and the latest technologies and an interest in professional sports, esports, and gaming.
typical work day at thescore:

have a deep understanding of how users interact with thescore’s sports app and website.
answer questions by using appropriate statistical techniques on available data.
report and analyze mobile, web, and social data through user path and engagement activity.
continuously improve analytics implementation and adapt to changing technologies.
develop, create and execute multivariate or a/b testing.
drive the data strategy across multiple listening posts (web, mobile, social, surveys, crm and, market research).
work with public apis like those of facebook and twitter.
stay on top of emerging trends in the digital industry.
other duties as required.

requirements:

2+ years of related experience.
university degree in computer science, statistics, business, or related field.
demonstrated ability to work with a variety of analytics tools such as, but not limited to: amplitude, localytics, upsight, google analytics. 
strong knowledge of analysis tools; r or python packages are preferred.
familiarity with relational databases and sql.
a passion and curiosity for solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches.
ability to take complex data and present it in a clear and simple manner.
ability to focus in a fast paced environment and multitask.
excellent written and oral communications skills.

 what we offer:

competitive salary with employee share purchase plan.
comprehensive benefits package.
fun, relaxed work environment.
education and conference reimbursements.
located downtown toronto; easily accessible by public transit.
a/v club, friday presentations, book library, and more.
snacks and drinks provided.
awesome patio with bbq.
games room (bring your a game for our fifa 17, ping pong and foosball tournaments!)

we are an equal opportunity employer. accommodation will be made upon request.

oct 2, 2017
                                

 reference code: 24202-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: toronto, ontario, canada 
all available locations: toronto 
external posting descriptiondeloitte's marketing and sales support group is seeking a marketing manager to support the analytics offerings.  as an integral member of a high performing team, you will be responsible for the planning and execution of a series of marketing related programs, sponsorship and events. you will also have an opportunity to work collaboratively with other internal clients to plan and execute on nationally driven programs.
 
reporting to the director, who leads the marketing efforts for high growth initiatives, this marketing manager is an energetic, ambitious individual with an aptitude for data analytics and who enjoys a fast paced, team oriented environment and strives for success and results.
 
responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:

assist in the development and effective implementation of marketing programs and initiatives including:
	
content development for analytics-related promotional materials (internal & client facing)
contact management programs
digital marketing
develop and maintain content for internet and intranet
speaker's programs
internal and external communications
public relations coordination
analyst relations
contact database maintenance
budget management, reporting and invoice processing
conference/event/tradeshow planning and execution
develop multi-channel marketing programs for internally developed thought-leadership to drive interest to internal stakeholders and/or external clients


ensure the tracking and reporting of roi on all major marketing activities/campaigns
ensure compliance with communication policies, procedures and brand standards
assist in the generation or identification/modification of content to support all marketing activities including; thought leadership, whitepaper, newsletter, invitations, survey material, internal and external communications
assist as requested in the creation and implementation of strategic marketing communications plans
work alongside subject matter experts to understand the business strategy and ensure marketing strategy is aligned
recommend integrated marketing communications programs and activities to achieve goals
coordinate with regional marketing professionals to facilitate the sharing of information at all levels and ensure continued coordination of plans and knowledge sharing
manage outside agencies, consultants, research vendors, and creative suppliers liaison with suppliers for promotional materials
research and respond to all internal and external information requests
prepare reports for team meeting and schedule/attend meetings as appropriate
participate in and contribute to other relevant projects
flexibility to work evenings and weekends when necessary
travel may be required

external posting qualifications
minimum of 5-7 years of marketing/communications experience, preferably in a business to business marketing communications environment and/or in the area of analytics. professional services marketing experience an asset
1-2 years of people management experience, preferably with larger cross-functional teams
bachelor's degree or diploma in marketing, communications or equivalent experience
some familiarity with the analytics marketplace
a demonstrated ability to link marketing strategy to lead generation
advanced microsoft office skills (word, excel, powerpoint, and outlook)
exceptional writing and verbal skills
excellent interpersonal skills and client service skills
strong attention to detail, administrative and organizational skills
event coordination experience
experience in negotiating contracts with external suppliers, vendors and associations
ability to prioritize, multi-task and perform in a deadline oriented environment
independent self-starter that possess initiative, creativity, and leadership skills
proven analytical skills and systematic problem solving
self-starter, independent and proactive in identifying opportunities for new and improved services
an enthusiastic professional who thrives in a fast paced, team environment and requires minimal supervision
proven track record in working with project and budget management
willingness to learn and a positive attitude
a solid work ethic, team player and comfortable liaising effectively with partners and staff across all levels
aptitude for technology
bilingual (french and english) an asset

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Senior Manager, Digital Experience & Insights
text:
job description - senior manager, digital experience & insights (17015518)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|all jobsbeginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - senior manager, digital experience & insights (17015518)job description senior manager, digital experience & insights requisition id: 17015518position type: regularposition status: full timejob: business analysiswork location: canada-ontario-toronto-40 dundas street west 3rd floorunposting date: oct 12, 2017, 10:59:00 pm description 
cibc is a leading canadian-based global financial institution
that’s been providing a full range of financial products and services to 11
million clients for 150 years. at cibc digital we provide personalized, simple,
yet flexible digital experiences for our clients, and accelerate revenue growth
for our bank. our client-centered approach builds relationships and improves
sales and service through our targeted offers, atm, web and mobile channels. working in an agile based startup environment, our team is
comprised of talent from across all verticals – banking, consulting,
technology, among others. we brainstorm and incubate ideas at our live labs at mars discovery district where we
challenge ourselves to see the world through the eyes of the client, then build
and test our way to success. and we have fun while we’re doing it! join our growing team of digital groundbreakers with the bank of
the future. you’ll fit right in if you… …think like an entrepreneur…can see through the client’s eyes…love to challenge the status quo…have a passion for all things digital…understand that collaboration is necessary for success to learn more about cibc’s lines of business check out our website. to learn more about cibc and the cibc group of companies please
visit cibc.com.  
job overview 

cibc’s digital insights boasts a unique experience within the
bank. positioned within cibc’s digital team, and with a startup-like
environment, the insights team is helping to lead the way in digital banking,
not just within our walls but canadian banking as well. for examples of current
digital banking solutions, please visit our website. reporting into the director of digital insights, the senior
manager is a high-impact role on a growing team. the senior manager is
accountable for overseeing a variety of projects and working closely with our
development teams, and for fostering an environment of collaboration,
problem-solving, knowledge-sharing and insight generation.  this
individual is responsible for delivering actionable insights that support
business strategy and objectives and that drive continuous enhancements to
transform the client experience of cibc’s digital properties. the ideal candidate will have a strong background in digital
analytics with a passion for understanding the broader context and uncovering
the story - the ‘why’ - behind the data. 

what you’ll be doing  1.  strategycontribute to the digital
insights roadmap and strategysupport and deliver key
strategic activities and milestones2.  relationship management continuously advocate for business
insights and customer experience metrics in all aspects of reporting
measurement.  help build trust, rapport, and credibility for digital
analytics across the organizationcollaborate with multiple teams to
correlate and share reporting, data, and insights, including:digital sales - to drive optimization
of online sales and marketingdigital strategy & innovation -
to help drive the strategic roadmapdesign & development - to help
implement changes to digital assets (online and mobile)many other business partners3.  analytics & insightsdevelop an effective reporting and
analysis framework aligned to overall business kpi’s, objectives, and goals
conducive to the optimization of all digital programs and projectswork with internal & external
partners to build a complete customer view in order to profile, segment and
optimize the user experience across digital platformsconsult with business partners to
understand business goals and the intended client journey. work collaboratively
to define and agree on kpis and target success metrics, as well as the desired
reporting format and frequency.work with the development team to
implement analytics tagging based on our standard data layer.  analyze and consolidate information from
multiple data sources (web analytics and offline data) using various reporting
toolsproduce recurring reports,
dashboards, and ad hoc reports for a wide variety of stakeholdershighlight and visualize findings and
insights in a clear and compelling manner, making it easy for stakeholders to
understand4.  benchmarkingdevelop and maintain
benchmark and trending analyses that support the business goals and customer
experience through the digital channelproactively report on
relevant multi-channel insights to provide context for performance relative to
other lines of business, and to industry-specific benchmarks

 what we’re looking for
university degree in business, math,
marketing, finance, information management, statistics or related field
(masters is an asset). solid understanding of research,
analytical and statistical methodologies and metrics and their application to
business measurement.must have 5+ years’ experience in
digital analytics, with proven track record of deriving business- and
client-related insightsmust have 5+ years of experience
using the adobe cloud platform – particularly adobe analytics (formerly
sitecatalyst), ad hoc (formerly discover), target (formerly test & target).understanding of the financial
services industryworking knowledge of online marketing
channelsunderstanding of web development best
practices, including knowledge of website design, html, javascript, and
analytics metrics and terminology.microsoft office suite (particularly
excel, access and powerpoint) - must know how to use pivot tables and macrosexperience with visualization tools
(tableau, etc.)sql database and olap reporting tools
(cognos, etc.)experience with mobile jdkconceptual thinker with proven
analytical and problem solving skills who can see the "big picture".
ability to translate data analysis into actionable business insights.excellent communication and
presentation skillsmotivated self-starter with ability
to multi-task and prioritize competing requests in a fast-paced environmentstrong interpersonal and
collaborative skills with ability to work independently and as a contributing
member of multi-disciplinary teams.
what cibc can offer you
flexible health benefits, stock
purchase plan, competitive incentive pay and recognition programscompetitive salary and banking benefitscareer growth, development and
continuous learning opportunitiesopportunity to be involved in cibc
events that help our communitiesclick to learn more about rewards &
recognition, learning &
development, and employee community
involvement
what you need to know
must be legally eligible to work in
canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a
valid work permit or study permit that allows the candidate to fulfill the
requirements of the role

title: Consulting Data Scientist
text:
pwc canada jobs - job details












                               canada    français english       pwc home industries research and insights services private companies up front tm press room events                   ?

jobs homesearch  openingssearch  resultscurrent pagejob  details   

job details job 1 of 1   apply to job   save to cart   view similar jobs      position id  11235br   title  consulting data scientist   line of service  consulting & deals   job type  full-time    city on - torontoqc - montreal    job description   achieve your full potential in an environment where there’s flexibility to cultivate your personal brand and knowledge base. pwc canada helps organizations and individuals create the value they’re looking for. more than 5,700 partners and staff in offices across the country are committed to delivering quality in assurance, tax, consulting and deals services. pwc canada is a member of the pwc network of firms with more than 180,000 people in 158 countries. consulting & deals: in our consulting & deals (c&d) practice, you’ll work with people who have a broad range of skills and expertise. it’s a great way to learn on the job and build on a variety of business skills that will serve you throughout your career. you’ll work with people who have deep subject matter expertise across a variety of industries, including: financial services; retail; technology and communications; mining and energy; as well as within the public sector. working with our professional’s means you’ll get the coaching and training you need to develop your career. analytics practice:pwc’s expanded data & analytics practice will be growing their presence throughout 2017 and 2018 in several key areas. we are looking to appoint our future leaders… people with an outstanding track record of delivering impactful results… people who have the vision and foresight to take their career to the next level and be part of a winning, collaborative team.  do you specialize within the big data/data science/artificial intelligence/behavioural economics space?  are you looking for an opportunity to further leverage your attributes and consulting experience while developing new skills at a ferocious pace? if this is the case then take a look at the below opportunities below that will be hiring in 2017 and into 2018.  job title: consulting data scientist our data scientists are client facing with an ability to understand complex business problems, and how to solve those problems by leveraging analytics applied on client and 3rd party data. the data scientist’s job is to also make the solution “real”, by integrating it into business processes. finding in those process points for automation of decisions and process through artificial intelligence.  the core consulting actions this role helps drive include:collaborating and contributing as a team member: understanding personal and team roles; contributing to a positive working environment by building solid relationships with team members; proactively seeking guidance, clarification and feedback. identifying and addressing client needs: building solid relationships with clients; approaching clients in an organized manner; delivering clear requests for information; demonstrating flexibility in prioritizing and completing tasks; communicating potential conflicts to a senior team member. prioritizing and handling multiple tasks; researching and analyzing pertinent client, industry, and technical matters; utilizing problem-solving skills; and, communicating effectively in written and verbal formats to various audiences (including various levels of management and external clients) in a professional business environment. coaching and collaborating with peers who assist with this work, including providing coaching, feedback and guidance on work performance. ability to help others think critically and share complex technical solutions to non-technical audiences both orally and in writing; proven strong consensus building abilities; proven skills to work effectively across internal functional areas in ambiguous situations. the core data science and research action this role drives include: understanding client data in the context of a client engagement objective (e.g. find process efficiency, increase marketing effectiveness, predict operational volume, automation manual processes and decision points)  designing solution leveraging cloud and existing enterprise architecture (e.g. leverage google, microsoft, and other major cloud capabilities) within the constraints of client architecture  internal research to drive intellectual property in key areas of focus for the analytics organization  collaborate with our major partnerships (i.e .with ai research centres across canada) on research and client problem solving  technical leadership on key analytic platforms on google and microsoft  collaborate with cross-functional internal and client teams  requirements:  ph.d. or ms in computer science, electrical engineering, statistics, applied math or related topics with at least 2 years of research or work experience in ai and automation strong background in machine learning (deep learning), ai and neural network concepts, and solid foundation of statistics theory experience in sql, relational databases, database concepts, dimensional modelling and database design python, r, and other scripting language expertise knowledge of key cloud platforms including google cloud platform and microsoft azure bilingual is a key asset why work for pwc be part of a dynamic, inclusive workplace environment, where you are valued for the unique contribution you bring. pwc is the world's largest professional services firm and is continuing to expand and move up in the industry. pwc is upping the game significantly in the consulting space. we have grown from 110k+ to 180+k people in the last 9 years. we have acquired some very high profile organizations as part of this growth, including strategy firms such as prtm, diamond, biond and now booz & co. we have also made a number of canadian acquisitions and continue to look for other additions to complement our business. pwc is rapidly expanding its data & analytics (d&a) practice with the expectation to more than double the practice in the next 2 years. im is considered among the five strategic big bets for the firm. this is an exciting place to be with innovative ideas, business models and career advancement opportunities. pwc approaches d&a from a business perspective. if you have been looking for an opportunity to expand from a technical base to become a more versatile management consultant, this is a golden opportunity. our d&a business is focused on information strategy / governance and bi / analytics, in particular. pwc invests in its people. we are fostering a learning culture that allows people to learn new skills and try different projects, while balancing the economics and constraints of the environments we do business in. take advantage of our comprehensive benefits, including our fitness allowance and wellness programs, which help you find better flexibility with work and other parts of your life. pwc is socially responsible. we have a csr office and a large foundation that invests in our community. we offer grant programs based on staff (volunteering) contributions to the community as well as education programs for board members of charities. pwc is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of the communities we serve.  we encourage qualified candidates, including aboriginals and persons with disabilities, to apply.  pwc: the opportunity of a lifetime     apply to job   save to cart   view similar jobs

(pla03261-17)job description senior digital analytics and insights consultant (performance consultant) - pla03261-17description what you’ll do:   as a senior digital analytics and insights consultant, you will play a key role in driving decision making to deliver results for the telus digital team.   we are looking for a data-driven individual who possesses strong knowledge of web analytics, is a clear communicator, and is able to quickly grasp business concepts. you will use these skills to help our product teams to deliver great digital experiences and enable the telus digital leadership team to make strategic planning decisions. candidates for the role should be curious to understand the ‘why’ behind the data and are excited about the opportunity data provides in creating a leading digital experience.    what you’ll be responsible for:   leverage data to tell the story of how the telus digital team is making progress on key metrics and uncover opportunities to improve the experience communicate findings and recommendations to audiences ranging from executives to working level team members follow the lean analytics guidelines of ‘build, measure, learn’ with product teams to ensure we are using data to define success, measure outcomes and consistently learn identify key segments for a/b testing and personalization use cases design, build, and maintain financial models to connect activities with key metrics and results for the telus digital team assist with decision making related to program budgets and prioritization by modeling the expected results of planned initiatives collaborate with the product teams on monthly planning cycles to review results and make prioritization decisions around upcoming work champion, coach, and mentor team members on best practices for using analytics to understand performance and inform decision making proactively identify opportunities to constantly improve our business processes qualifications what you’ll need to be successful:  bachelor’s or master’s degree in a field such as economics, marketing, engineering, mathematics, computer science, information management or other business related fields 3+ years of experience using web analytics tools (adobe preferred) to analyze digital experiences, find opportunities, and make recommendations proficiency making data visualizations and dashboards using tools like domo, tableau, or qlik experience building financial models and presenting business cases experience with a/b testing is an asset experience writing sql queries to access and analyze data is an asset experience with using python or r for data processing and analysis is an asset experience with seo is an asset demonstrates strong leadership and communication skills  about telus digital:   telus digital is a team of highly skilled professionals dedicated to building innovative, data-driven, customer centric digital experiences. we run like a start-up, we’ve embraced lean and agile methodologies. we celebrate our failures and see them as opportunities to learn. our culture fosters collaborative learning and out-of-the-box thinking in a relaxed environment.    we want to work with people who:   have a passion for the web and all things digital thrive in a lean, fast paced and changing environment view collaboration as essential to your work clearly see things from the perspective our customers utilize the power of data to inform decisions continually refine their practice and process  what you can expect from us:  we don’t come to work in suits or sit all day long in grey cubicles; we come as we are, keen to share our latest ideas we want you to help shape and shift our culture in brave new directions, not simply fit in our teams work and play everyday; great ideas can come as easily during an impromptu hallway soccer match or social team building activity outside the office; we don’t discriminate fuel for thought… ours comes in the form of weekly lunches and an unending supply of healthy snacks bottom line? what matters at telus digital is creating a free flowing, stimulating, supportive space where every one of us can thrive and feel alive  our team is growing. we’re looking for talented individuals like yourself. apply now!   who is telus?   we're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make telus one of the leading telecommunications companies in canada. our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and optik tv™. we also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.   everyone belongs at telus. it doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at telus, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.   do you share our passion?       at telus, you create future friendly® possibilities.   at telus, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.primary location: ca-on-torontoschedule: full-timeaccessibilitytelus is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. we are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

title: Manager, Analytics
text:
job description - manager, analytics (0089604)go to the main content section.careers at loyaltyonelearn more about our opportunitieslife at loyaltyoneour teamswelcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - manager, analytics (0089604)job description manager, analytics - (0089604) the opportunity

as the analytics manager on the global solutions team, you will lead the delivery of effective, timely and best in class initiatives and consulting engagements globally. we are looking for someone who is a self-starter, comfortable working cross-functionally in partnership with all stakeholders, and an outstanding analytic storyteller. you’ll be detail-oriented and results driven to achieve the organization’s vision for analytics capabilities. 
 
you will be partnering with the consulting, data science, product development and technology teams, to identify and deliver actionable insights. you will collaboratively support client financial goals, partner, member, and campaign measurement, as well as cost optimization.
 
this is an opportunity to innovate, deepen our existing client relationships, and help establish loyaltyone as a leader in this space.
 
what you’ll do

lead and manage advanced data analysis to identify and deliver actionable insights (key driver analysis, churn analysis, customer segmentation)
lead and execute data extraction, transformation and mapping activities
design the analytics plan for engagements, including data requirements and methodology 
provide thought leadership and coaching to a team of quantitative specialists in the delivery of data insight, development of complex analytical and statistical models, optimization of campaign execution and measurement to achieve financial performance targets
build insight and provide interpretation of results linking analytical perspective to objectives and identify new or innovative paths to accomplish or exceed goals
work with the client to establish operational processes for analytics execution that ensures appropriate safeguards for data
generate and support content focused on analytics thought leadership for external publication
participate in business development pitches by sharing thought leadership & advanced analytical solutions that solve customer problems
manage the process for standardization of the analytics methodologies and tools and automation  who you are


strong business acumen and understanding of direct marketing, interpreting research, extracting insights and communicating a compelling summary of findings to drive results

solid understanding of the retail industry and how consumer information and analytics is leveraged to generate revenue and financial modeling

a collaborative leader who has a keen interest in developing others

an excellent problem solver with an eye to future opportunities

ability to manage and thrive in a matrix organization and effectively communicate with all audiences 
what you have 

bachelor’s degree in statistics, economics, computer science, applied math or math
master’s degree is required (preferred programs include management/business analytics, operations research)    
minimum of 3-5 years of directly related work experience in managing analysis and insight delivery
minimum of 1 year of supervisory/management experience 
advanced skills in excel and powerpoint 
proficent in sas, visualization tools (qlick, tableau, microstrategy), r, python, sql
proficiency with spark, scala and alteryx. experience with aws and cloud deployments is preferred 
about loyaltyone

loyaltyone is a global leader in the design and implementation of coalition loyalty programs, customer analytics, and loyalty services for fortune 1000 clients around the world. loyaltyone has over 20 years history leveraging data-driven insights to develop and operate some of the world's most effective loyalty programs and customer-centric solutions. these include the air miles reward program, north america's premier coalition loyalty program, precima, the global retail strategy and analytics arm, loyaltyone consulting, european-based brandloyalty, and latin america's leading coalition program, dotz. loyaltyone is an alliance data company. www.loyalty.com 
 
about ads
 
alliance data® (nyse: ads) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. the company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. alliance data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. an s&p 500 and fortune 500 company headquartered in plano, texas, alliance data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com 
 
employment opportunity employer. accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.

text:

home
careers

analytics manager












analytics manager


department: marketing
location: toronto, canada 

apply for this position


we’re a tight-knit group of analytical minded, self declared ‘nerds’, who provide marketing intelligence for the world’s greatest small-group adventure travel company. we work fast. we work hard. we serve a global brand that stubbornly refuses to stop growing. we do it all in-house, and we have a blast making it all happen.
the g adventures marketing intelligence team is on the hunt for a passionate, intelligent, experienced, hard-working and authentic analytics manager. if you fit the bill, give us a call. we can’t wait to meet you.
at g adventures, we’re obsessed with the customer, our traveller; it’s about engaging and connecting emotionally with each and every one of them, along each and every step of their journey - so they keep coming back for more. 
as analytics manager, you will lead the charge in delivering proactive marketing and sales insights to support our business. you will provide recommendations for optimizing the customer experience, marketing channel spend and campaign strategy. you will consult with teams across g adventures to understand our key business issues and will work with your team to deliver data driven, actionable insights. you are our in-house marketing research consultant.
the right candidate has a passion for, and deep understanding of, analytics and can easily communicate insights to stakeholders with varying levels of data savviness. someone who embraces and champions the ‘democratization of data’ notion and approach. an inspiring leader, committed to growing and developing their team. someone with opinions, and the ability to express them. someone who aspires to use their strong strategic and analytical skills to help change people’s lives through travel. sound like a lofty goal? we live and breathe our brand promise every day so, if this sounds like you, we want you on our team.
responsibilities

lead, develop and mentor a dynamic team consisting of a digital analyst, data analyst, and (junior) data analyst, enabling and empowering these individuals to deliver marketing intelligence excellence through positive support, guidance and inspiration. hire, guide and develop with finesse
understand and become an expert in our industry, our business, our culture and our customer, and use that knowledge to create effective, impactful, strategic and shareworthy work
work closely with the analyst team to complete complex analyses which are, importantly, actionable
manage and actively contribute to the day-to-day workload of the team, ensuring all team goals met in a timely manner
proactively deliver insights around marketing kpis, campaign strategy, measurement plans, reporting and post mortem processes
proactively deliver recommendations for optimizing the customer experience, marketing channel spend and campaign strategy
manage a repository of learnings and best practices and ensure results are socialized
act as the lead resource for the global and regional marketing teams and other departments for anything marketing analytics related, on a day-to-day basis 
lead with service - we’re an in-house agency! - and contribute to an engaged and dynamic corporate culture

requirements

bachelor's degree in marketing, math, statistics, economics or a related field
4+ years of demonstrated experience as an analyst, preferably in roles supporting marketing analysis
1+ years of experience in a management position, preferably where overseeing analysts
intermediate sql knowledge and understanding of relational databases is required
has solid experience working with various data sources
has experience with digital analytics
a strong analytical thinker with a natural intellectual curiosity
is able to translate complex data into precise and simple insights for business partners
demonstrates the ability to critique and discuss his/her own work and the work of others in a constructive manner
possesses excellent communication and influencing skills, combined with strong oral presentation skills
is both collaborative and proficient at building positive working relationships with multi-disciplinary stakeholders across the business 
possesses strong computer/technology skills and is highly proficient in microsoft office, excel, powerpoint and keynote
experience with salesforce is an asset
experience with business intelligence tools is an asset
experience with data warehouses and etl processes an asset
experience with workfront or other project management software is an asset
experience in data science is an asset

we thank all interested candidates however only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.
***qualified applicants must hold appropriate citizenship or documents permitting them to reside and work in canada***
g adventures is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. we consider all qualified applicants and will meet the needs of those requiring reasonable accommodations.

title: Data Science Team Lead
text:
data science team lead - samsung research america - job board view our website view all jobs samsung research america is looking for the best and brightest to join our team.if you’re passionate about technology and want to work in a fun, collaborative environment, we want to meet you! data science team lead toronto, canada full time advanced applied research experienced general description: this is a great opportunity for an experienced data scientist to build and lead our data science team in samsung’s toronto applied ai research lab.  the lead will be involved in conceiving of, planning, and delivering capabilities for current and future samsung devices and services.  as samsung is one of the largest technology companies with a global reach that includes dozens of product categories and hundreds of millions of users and devices, this team will have an extremely product impact.   come join samsung and help us define and develop the future of consumer electronics and services! responsibilities include: build and lead the data science team lead and mentor a growing team with varied experience levels technical leadership for innovating on, implementing, and scaling algorithms and data-driven systems. solve data analytics problems and deliver results troubleshoot issues, implement fixes, and apply enhancement to data platform system work with other technical leaders inside samsung work with customers and partners on deployments and technical integrations investigate technologies and make technology recommendations create prototypes and proof-of-concepts of future product capabilities.   required experience: 5-10 years of hands-on experience in data-driven machine learning and analytics. 3-5 years of experience team leadership. experience with practical data-driven platforms at scale. experience with data management platforms (hadoop, spark, kafka) proficiency in some of the following areas: information retrieval, natural language processing, sentimental analysis, time services analytics, pattern recognition, and predictive models. excellent communication and interpersonal skills preferred experience: experience using machine learning on language processing such as sentiment analysis, topic extraction, summarization is preferred (optional) experience using knowledge construction is also preferred (optional) hands-on experience in architecting data processing platform is a big plus read more apply for position apply for this position required* apply with linkedin apply with indeed apply with indeed first name* last name* email address* address phone* resume* attach resume or paste resume attach resume as .pdf, .doc, or .docx (limit 2mb) or paste resume paste your resume here or attach resume file cover letter in 150 characters or fewer, tell us what makes you unique. try to be creative and say something that will catch our eye! life at deloitte

data science careers at deloitte

                                        
                                            our data scientists discuss their passion and careers

 this video series shows the many faces of data science at deloitte, from data modelers to analytics enthusiasts, and why they chose a career with us. 

the faces of data science at deloittewhat are data scientists like? they’re as unique and varied as the stories they tell with data. the truth is, there’s no single type of data scientist. our data science professionals have an array of interests and passions that attracted them to the field, and they are empowered to create their own paths forward.here are some of the data scientists that call deloitte home:the data science thrill-seekermany children dream of riding the roller coasters at disneyworld—but not many dream of taking the plunge into the world of data science as a career. one consultant began to think of a career in data science after a talk on analytics by disney's head of operations research. learning about the inner workings of disneyworld sparked an interest and led to a career in data science at deloitte.the data science numbers loverto some of us, numbers are numbers. but to one deloitte manager, it was that first college statistics class that hooked her on everything data. the idea that data can make meaning of the world was something so intriguing that it became a quest, a passion, and ultimately a career.the data science super modelersometimes, data scientists enter the field because they've already dabbled in data in a related discipline. that's the case for one of our data science consultants who studied computer science, then entered the workforce supporting analytics implementations. a fascination with building data models led to an interest in predictive modeling and data mining.helping people was a source of inspiration for one analyst. the ability to build models that could turn volumes of data into insights, approaches, and solutions that could help many people was too powerful to ignore.
read more 







perspectives

end users and data everywhere

                                        
                                            part 1: cloud and infrastructure article series

 legacy data centers are falling farther and farther behind as the adoption of cloud computing contributes to better mobile end-user experiences. 

widespread adoption of cloud computing and the evolution of the end-user experience are dramatically changing the corporate office. end users are on the move on different devices—and so is end-user data. as customer and enterprise data moves across both internal and external telephony and wireless networks, cios are facing growing challenges around control and management of enterprise it and data flow to and from the data center (which may now be external).
read more 







perspectives

natural language generation and data science

                                        
                                            interview with kris hammond, chief scientist, narrative science

 what is natural language generation, what should clients be doing about nlg, and what is its future? get answers from kris hammond, deloitte’s chief scientist. 

surrounded by a wealth of data that’s growing all the time, we look to machines to make sense of it. natural language generation is part of a larger ecosystem in artificial intelligence, cognitive computing, and analytics that helps us turn data into facts and draw important conclusions from those facts. this is how we can make data highly useful and highly relevant in a contextual way. learn how natural language generation takes facts that machines can understand and turns them into a language that humans can process and act upon.​
read more 







perspectives

mobile device security risks: keeping data safe

                                        
                                            corporate cybersecurity in a mobile world

 security of data for mobile devices is a key concern for corporations and individuals. what potential mobile device security risks could you be facing? 

risks and opportunities​who are you? the computer wants to know. convincing the machine you are who you claim to be is at the heart of network security. for the vast majority of us—those committed to safeguarding bank accounts, personal data, corporate patents, and inside information—security of data hinges on establishing our identity in a way that no one, man or machine, can replicate.you might think that mobile device security risks are rising. after all, global workers are venturing far outside old corporate firewalls. from the ballpark to the beach, they’re using their own smartphones and tablets to copy and forward proprietary documents and spreadsheets. and much of this data is stored on cloud computers belonging to other companies. add it all up, and it may appear as though corporations have utterly lost control of their secrets.security companies stress these risks and the need for security in their marketing. “but we’re not simply at the mercy of the attackers,” says  michael wyatt , managing director, deloitte   touche llp, and identity management solution leader in deloitte advisory’s cyber risk services. in the end, wyatt says, smartphones in the hands of mobile workers may prove to be more secure than the old cubicle pc equipped and vetted by the tech department. “the developments that people associate with increased mobile device security risks also create opportunities for new solutions.”
