apply online



view job description





			are you an it professional with a keen interest using data analytics to develop of capacity planning solutions for datacenter and cloud environments? then consider these exciting opportunities with the treasury board secretariat, infrastructure technology services.depending on the successful candidates, these positions may be located at:- 222 jarvis street, toronto- 1000 southgate drive, guelph- 49 place d'armes, kingston- 200 first avenue west, north bay- 33 king street west, oshawa- 300 water street, peterborough- 301 st. paul street, st. catharines- 435 james street south, thunder baywhat can i expect to do in this role?you will:• provide expert consultation to clients and staff regarding the use and deployment of optimal technology solutions.• conduct feasibility studies and identify pilot projects for new technologies.• coordinate with partners and stakeholders to ensure the availability of technology infrastructure required for completion of capacity plans.• develop policies, guidelines and procedures to enhance the usability, functionality, integrity, security and effectiveness of services.• develop capacity and performance plans using automation and data analytic tools.• resolve technical problems related to capacity requirements• review technical publications and prepare user guides.• deliver presentations and participate on committees.how do i qualify?technical expertise:• you have demonstrated knowledge of the design, development and implementation of computer systems/applications, database management systems, spreadsheet/groupware applications and technical options that leverage capacity capabilities.• you have systems consulting experience with emphasis on the management group taken from a business point of view.• you have knowledge of electronic mail systems, their design and administration, and the gateways required to interconnect them.• you have knowledge of lan-based software products.• you have knowledge of remote access to lans and electronic mail systems.• you have experience with setup, debugging and repairing computer hardware.• you have knowledge of and experience with strategic and tactical capacity planning methodologies from technology and business perspectives, and associated tools/technologies for service delivery.• you have knowledge of executive information systems (e.g. eda tools and groupware) and their unique capacity/performance management requirements.communication, interpersonal and teamwork skills:• you have excellent consulting, interpersonal, teamwork and negotiation skills to work with a wide range of contacts in the provision of cost effective and timely service delivery.• you have effective communication skills to provide technical leadership and mentoring to staff and team members.• you demonstrate tact and diplomacy.• you can develop and present complex information in understandable terms.• you can deliver training and prepare guidelines and operating procedures.analytical, problem-solving and organizational skills:• you have strong analytical, problem-solving and decision making skills.• you demonstrate innovative thinking skills.• you can organize and prioritize work and concurrently manage a number of initiatives.• you can work in a high volume, stressful environment and manage a diverse workload with frequent interruptions.accounting skills:• you have knowledge of accounting procedures.• you can manage financial resources and prepare budgets, capacity plans, business cases and cost/benefit analyses.



			additional information:

title: Analyst, Research & Development
text: rsa | career opportunities ­ français contact us home / career opportunities / analyst, research & development job details addthis | email favorites linkedin facebook twitter analyst, research & development position id:  j0917-0798 job type:  permanent full time job location:  toronto, ontario, canada job category:  actuarial year(s) of experience:  3+ posting date (dd/mm/yyyy):  26/09/2017 closing date (dd/mm/yyyy):  13/10/2017 keeping you moving rsa is one of the world’s leading multinational insurance groups with over 300 years of experience and over 20 million customers worldwide.our people are committed to building a dynamic internal culture where our people love what they do and feel motivated to keep things moving – for customers, for their colleagues and as part of their own growth and development. in rsa, employing positive people is how we achieve success. you will be working in an environment that encourages you to do great work and you constantly will be faced with fresh challenges that have a direct impact on our business. we believe your personality and passion will keep rsa and our business moving forward. at rsa we have a culture that supports and rewards high performance with a competitive reward policy for top performers. our rewards package includes competitive compensation, work / life balance, opportunities to learn and the chance to make a difference working for a worldwide industry leader. video: working at rsa position overview: the analyst, research & development will be a part of the research & development unit in the pricing centre of excellence. you will support the pricing and underwriting objectives of the business through the use of advanced analytics. reporting to the manager, research & development, you will enhance our analytics capability through innovation and will embed best practices throughout pricing and underwriting analytics teams.about the pricing centre of excellence in canada: pricing sophistication is a key business priority for rsa and an important area of investment to empower us to be more competitive. as the industry landscape and customer expectations evolve, our objective is to be more sophisticated in our risk understanding and to be more agile in responding to changing customer needs by having deeper insights in our pricing. in order to bring rsa in line with best-in-class pricing capabilities, we recently created a pricing centre of excellence (coe) in canada and have substantially increased its resources. the pricing coe contains core personal lines pricing units, as well as a dedicated research and development unit. this is an exciting opportunity to join a rapidly developing team focused on driving pricing innovation and best practices in order to make a material difference to our business. who you are your enthusiasm is infectious. you challenge the status quo. you find solutions to problems. you go the extra mile to exceed customers’ expectations. you get things done the right way. you represent our brand with passion and pride. you are a team player. you have fun and you make work fun for those working around you. what you will achieve in this role • develop new predictive models to be used for pricing and underwriting; • drive modelling sophistication through research and analysis of advanced statistical techniques;• design, build and maintain market-leading rating algorithms;• develop, enhance, and promote modelling best practices, including providing training to junior analysts and other teams; • investigate, develop, and enhance data quality and data manipulation processes;• contribute to the development of winning pricing strategies; and• engage, support, and influence business partners to drive pricing sophistication and deliver results what you bring to this role • university/college or master degree in actuarial science, mathematics, or statistics; • minimum 3+ years relevant pricing/predictive analytics experience or relevant statistical experience;• technical expertise in predictive analytics, ideally including experience with sas, r, emblem, and radar; • out-of-the-box thinker, always striving for the next innovation; • proven ability to turn innovative insight into implementable value-driving solutions• demonstrated success in people, project, and relationship management;• knowledge of property and casualty insurance; and• outstanding communication skills (both oral and written) other information applicants agree that by providing personal information in response to this ad, and otherwise in any recruitment process with rsa or its affiliated companies (the “company”) such personal information may be retained and used for a period of one (1) year from the date of this application, for the purpose of consideration for employment opportunities which may arise during that time period, unless an applicant notifies the company to the contrary.we thank all applicants. however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.we invite you to learn more about us at our career site, www.rsagroup.ca, where you can apply on line. rsa group of companies is strongly committed to diversity and welcomes applications from visible minority group members, women, aboriginal persons, and persons with disabilities, members of the lgbt community, and others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.rsa group of companies will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in the job application process.if you have difficulty using our online application system and you need an accommodation due to a disability, please email aoda@rsagroup.ca or call us at toll free 1 (800)-855-0511. please note this email is only for accommodation requests. resumes sent to this email address will not be considered. skills: actuarial scienceanalytical skillsassociate actuaryinsurance - property & casualtyuniversity degreeverbal communication skillswritten communication skills where did you first learn about this position?* -- select one -- an employee referral i am a current rsa employee i am a current cns employee i am a current johnson employee i am a previous rsa employee i am a previous cns employee i am a previous johnson employee reference#: ne033728 ... eluta reference#: ex175826 ... indeed.com reference#: ex175827 ... johnson corporate web site reference#: ex175828 ... johnson intranet web site reference#: ex175829 ... linkedin reference#: ex175830 ... rsa corporate web site reference#: ex175831 ... rsa intranet web site applicants agree that by providing personal information in response to this ad, and otherwise in any recruitment process with rsa or its affiliated companies (the “company”) such personal information may be retained and used for a period of one (1) year from the date of this application, for the purpose of consideration for employment opportunities which may arise during that time period, unless an applicant notifies the company to the contrary. rsa is an equal opportunity employer. we thank all applicants for their interest. however, only those selected for an interview title: Strategic Insights Analyst
text:
strategic insights analyst - dac group - job board view our website view all jobs thanks for visiting our job board. please review our open positions and apply to the positions that match your qualifications. strategic insights analyst toronto, ontario, canada full time strategy mid level leading digital performance agency the best strategies rise from thorough research and knowing your opponent—er, client---inside and out. whether it’s an existing engagement or a new business pitch, we need expert analysts to lay the strategic groundwork before we can launch a successful digital marketing campaign. that’s where you come in—our geeks with personality on the strategic insights team are on the hunt for a talented researcher with a knack for extracting a coherent game plan from a jumble of statistics and trends. think you have what it takes to inspire big ideas and guide us towards cutting-edge marketing breakthroughs? get in touch today! *bonus points if you’re an expert chess player and you’ll never turn down an intense game of risk.  what you get the opportunity to shape the future – yours and ours – at a well-established and fast-growing digital performance marketing agency with offices across the us, canada and europe. the chance to contribute to the creative and strategic direction of a top digital performance agency and work alongside a team of passionate research professionals. a competitive salary and benefits package, plus profit sharing. a modern, recently renovated working environment in toronto, complete with free parking, collaborative spaces, pint-pong table, treadmill desk, free in-building gym and easy access to public transit (three-minute walk to leslie subway station)  what we get a strong multi-tasker who can handle pressure and meet deadlines without sacrificing the quality of their work. a professional with excellent written and verbal communication skills who can use a variety of programs to convey stories to our clients a thorough researcher with experience using google analytics and google adwords to spot, analyze and understand trends. knowledge of spss is a huge plus. experience with graphics programs such as photoshop, fireworks, paintshop, and image composer to create engaging presentations a plus. a team player with experience using microsoft powerpoint, word, excel and/or access, and outlook. a confident speaker with experience taking data and turning it into a visual presentation that tells a story for clients and colleagues.  position accountabilities research and analysis: conduct market, industry and competitive research using in-house tools and databases to extract relevant insights to inform our clients’ digital marketing efforts. act as power user of research tools including hitwise, netbase, comscore, pmb/telmar, google analytics, and a key user of semrush, etc examples of types of research include: market / audience research: demographic, geographic, psychographic and behavioral research to develop detailed audience personas for clients. includes cross-tabulating data from multiple sources in order to build a convincing story. competitive audits: conduct analyses of multiple competitors to identify positioning, gaps, opportunities and rankings. social conversation research: handle social media conversation audit requests and act as netbase power user for social engagements, social pitches or new business pitches media audits: keyword research, share of search, ranking reports and competitive spending information. strategic insights and presentation building: build and assemble powerpoint decks and presentation content using extracted research data translate market, competitive and industry data into compelling storytelling presentations with meaningful conclusions and recommendations strong ability to identify the key takeaways or “so whats?” from a large quantity of data thought leadership and dac research support: assist with interviewing, writing, editing, proofreading and supporting the production of dac group white papers, original research and other thought leadership content. develop povs and participate as sme/write for dac blog initiative media and account support: planning efforts to support display and search teams using predictive modeling software one-off account team requests that can vary in scope, urgency, and topic monthly communications to teams on search/iyp landscape miscellaneous responsibilities: contribute to dac group task forces, ad-hoc committees etc as needed on a volunteer basis maintain organization of marketing data on “intranet” and marketing and of paper files attend semi-regular vendor meetings and express questions/concerns in order to represent dac pull together final reports for the customer service satisfaction survey what we want it’s really very simple: we want to know what makes you special. send us an application that showcases your talent – and your personality – and shows us how you would thrive in our unique agency environment. read more apply for position apply for this position required* apply with linkedin apply with indeed apply with indeed first name* last name* email address* address phone* resume* attach resume or paste resume attach resume as .pdf, .doc, or .docx (limit 2mb) or paste resume paste your resume here or attach resume file cover letter* in 150 characters or fewer, tell us what makes you unique. try to be creative and say something that will catch our eye!* 150 submit application ×close forward this position recipient email address (one) your name your email address enter a message (optional) the message cannot contain links human check* privacy & terms

job postings: sunnybrook research institute apply for position research associate  posted: 09/21/2017 8:54:09 am   research associate, sunnybrook research institute status: temporary full-time, 1 year term with the possibility of renewal dr. hannah wunsch, md msc, senior scientist at the sunnybrook research institute and associate professor at the university of toronto is seeking a temporary full-time (1-year contract) research associate. this individual will join her established research program of clinical epidemiologists and pharmaco-epidemiologists to examine medication prescribing in surgical and critically ill patients in canada and the united states using large databases. this position offers the successful individual the ability to lead on specific projects and analyses related to an nih grant focused on opioid prescriptions for surgical patients in ontario. key responsibilities carry out project-specific activities from project initiation to project completion. develop data creation plans to create study cohorts and analytic plans clean and analyze large datasets using sas, r, or other statistical packages work closely with a phd statistician for complex modeling review and interpret analytic output draft and prepare reports, manuscripts, presentations and abstracts monitor project timelines, liaise with team members to ensure timely completion of projects assist with grant writing and research ethics board applications other duties as appropriate for the team skills and qualifications a masters or phd in clinical epidemiology or related field strong quantitative research skills with the ability to independently develop an analytic approach experience using large, administrative datasets (e.g. ices, cihi, or medicare) strong data management and analytic skills, e.g. cohort creation, defining variables competency using statistical software and willingness to learn new applications (experience with sas is preferred) ability to work closely as a team and provide assistance to support team members ability to work independently while achieving specific goals within specific timeframes strong organizational and time management skills to manage and prioritize work load and timelines strong verbal and written communication skills this position is full-time for a one-year contract, with the possibility of renewal. salary will be commensurate with experience. please send a cover letter and curriculum vitae in one pdf document to meredith.malloy@sunnybrook.ca) we thank all applicants, but please note that we will only contact individuals who are to be interviewed. sunnybrook research institute is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act (aoda). if you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter. sunnybrook research institute is strongly committed to inclusion and diversity within its community and welcomes all applicants including but not limited to: visible minorities, all religions and ethnicities, persons with disabilities, lgbtq persons, and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. « back to sunnybrook research institute   privacy policy terms of use site map careers staff only copyright © 2017 sunnybrook health sciences centre. all rights reserved.

description

position at ddb canada


data analyst the analyst, marketing analytics will pair their considerable digital marketing experience with skills in data collection and analytics to deliver valuable insights and evidence-driven strategy for our internal teams and clients. in this role, you will be driven to find ways to solve complex challenges that may involve creative, strategic, technical and analytical aspects. he/she must have experience in finding and applying data-driven insights to lead business and marketing strategy. he/she will be a strong and confident communicator, who is adaptable to many different levels of data availability, analytics maturity and toolsets.you will:guide the development of key processes by supporting, prioritizing, defining, and gathering needs for the cross-functional projects; convert this data into business narratives for areas of developmentlead analytics on projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysis and data miningensure the integrity of analytics data by ensuring policies around data governance and working with agency and client teams to provide tools and trainingdrive strategy for customer acquisition and customer conversion by developing advanced analytics models, forecasts, and analyses that are based on previous activity and benchmark datainterpret analytical findings and/or recommend an approach and solution(s) that are relative to the strategic objectives of the project, company, and stakeholder needsuse advanced analytics techniques on large data sets for the purpose of delivering ad hoc analyses and insights; formulate analytics-enabled solutions in an online advertising environmentfacilitate and perform consistent and reliable data collection, utilizing primary and secondary research methods; perform analysis for testing, targeting, creative and offerscreation of post campaign reporting and work with design teams to build engaging data visualizationyou must have:curious, self-starter, works independently and within a team environmentundergraduate degree in social sciences, business, computer science, mathematics or related quantitative discipline3+ years analytical experience: strong problem solving skills, flexible, adaptable, resourceful, assertive & proactive, able to simplify and package complex ideas for presentation/discussionstrong understanding of database design, database management, data warehousing, data mining, feature enrichment, feature engineering, variable creation, variable selectionknowledge of etl processesat least 1 year working experience on sql server and intermediate level of sql skills including sql server intergration services (ssis)knowledge of digital, social and mobile marketing principles within the context of broader mass communicationsexperience in using analytics to effectively drive digital strategy and business transformationkeen ability to work within a team, with experience of project ownership/leadershipa strategic and analytical in approach to your work; job description


ibm global business services: join a leader. consult with us.ibm global business services helps top-tier clients solve their most complex business and technical issues. as a data scientist, you will deliver innovative business consulting, business process design, systems integration, and application design and management to leading sector organizations in 17 industries worldwide. with access to resources that only a global leader can provide, you will learn valuable skills, gain access to a vast and diverse network of talented professionals, and enjoy unparalleled career, training, and educational opportunities.visit http://www.ibm.com/ca/ for more informationthe data scientist will be familiar with key internal and external data sources and how they are gathered and retrieved; experience with manipulation large volumes of data leveraging hadoop and open source technologies is essential. the incumbent will be experienced with various languages and tools and able to select a suitable tool for the analytics solution or working with data.in addition to broad and deep data and analytics skills, the data scientist has strong business acumen, coupled with the ability to communicate findings to both business and it leaders in a way that can influence how an organization approaches a business challenge. incumbents also advise on and select the business problems that have the most value for the organization.a successful candidate must have hands-on experience working with advanced analytics (spss, sas, r) and hadoop big data ecosystem (hdfs, map/reduce, hive, hbase, sqoop, etc.), with an understanding of the following:data mining and business problem definition (experience with crisp dm or similar methodology)analytical and quantitative conceptsmachine learning techniquesdemonstrated ability to learn new tools and solutions quickly

title: Data Scientist
text:
tucows careers - data scientist



























 











                                                    tucows careers                                            






                data scientist
    
    

                            analytics & insights            
                    toronto,
                            ontario
                
                        



        apply
    



preamble:tucows is looking to add two data scientists to our analytics & insights team. together, we’re responsible for all of the reporting, analytics, data flows, visualization, machine learning and related business intelligence operations within the company.  success in this role requires four related components.  the first is that at your core, you are curious.  you live for going down the rabbit hole. chasing mysteries, finding quirks, and peeling back all the layers.  finding new questions to you is almost as fun as answering them, but answer them you do, with solid statistical proof displayed in clear language and compelling visualizations. the second requirement is an ability and interest in understanding our business.   we’ve got lots of data, but it’s not going to turn itself into information, and you can’t help with that unless you understand what the numbers mean.  learning about our business will be made both easy and fun by your deep and passionate love of the internet.  you believe it’s powerfully transformative and even, perhaps, the greatest thing ever.  you can’t wait to be a part of helping tucows make the internet even more awesome. the third component is that you really, for serious­, love math and coding. your arsenal of algorithms is both deep and broad.  you know precisely which tool is right for the job and you also know why.the last, but certainly not least, component is the ability and willingness to continuously learn about new technologies. the data science ecosystem is a fast-evolving beast. newer and more powerful tools are released all the time. you are a data scientist who is constantly updating their knowledge of data science state-of-the-art.if you have these four qualities, you’ll find tucows an exciting, ambitious and supportive environment in which to do impactful data science work.  main purpose of position:responsible for the provision of information to drive business decision making, via:ongoing collaboration with business specialists to understand drivers and needsanalysis of our unique data sets, including:sales and usage dataweb and social analyticsunstructured text  forecasting and time series data analyticsleveraging existing data sets to provide predictive informationongoing evaluation of available structured and unstructured data setsexperimentation with data to find useful insights application of machine learning (regression, clustering, classification, deep learning etc) processes and techniquesapplication of natural language processing techniques and toolskey position responsibilities/objectives:% of time | description of task / duty25% | responsible for cooperative ongoing dialogue on business requirements for information50% | responsible for self-directed research into available data sets and the various possibilities for extracting information relevant to the business, and for engagement of business functions in the evaluation of results15% | responsible for evolution of tools and techniques for the extraction and delivery of information and insights to internal and external customers10% | responsible for documentation of processes for converting data into information, and training/assistance for internal resources on how best to utilize the resulting reports etc.knowledge, skills & abilitiestop-notch communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skillsexcellent math and statistical analysis skills, especially as they pertain to business and experimentationdeep knowledge and experience of the algorithms and techniques of modern data sciencean interest and proficiency in the presentation and visualization of numbers and statistical dataability to understand business imperatives and drivers, find relevant data correlations, and create processes by which the data correlations are translated to information flows that help drive the business3-5 years of quantitative analysis experience, including handling, manipulating and analyzing data and creating analytical reportsknowledge and experience of semantic and sentiment analysis, machine learning and natural language processingcomfortable writing complex sql queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sourcescomfortable using programming languages such as python and/or r to work with data setsexcellent knowledge of microsoft excel and google docsability to document work and effectively prioritize documentationability to work on multiple projects in parallel while managing constantly changing deadlines and prioritiesnice to haves:experience with hadoop, spark and similar data storage and processing toolsexperience with deep learning methodologiesm.s. or phd, preferably in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field

tucows is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment and is an equal opportunity employer. if you have any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process, please notify us so we can provide suitable accommodation.

with a vision to become the leading workplace compensation board, the workplace safety and insurance board (wsib) provides no-fault insurance and compensation for ontarians in the event of a workplace injury or illness.  we are committed to delivering what matters: fast, accessible service and fair benefits at a fair price.we've recently launched a comprehensive plan for modernizing and revitalizing the wsib. this is an exciting time for the organization, and we invite you to be a part of it as we work to grow and improve the services we provide. recognized as a best-in-class learning organization, we promote professional development and are committed to providing our people with opportunities to lead, learn and grow, ensuring that we're providing the best possible service to the people of ontario.  we offer a market-competitive total compensation plan and a robust wellness program that promotes a healthy lifestyle as well as work/life balance.the work we do at the wsib is meaningful and challenging and it makes a difference to the people of ontario.  we value integrity, reliability and fairness, and we embrace the diversity of the people we work with and serve. 






job summary:the claim information specialist draws upon their knowledge of data science and  health information management theory to make appropriate interpretations of the ill or injured worker’s claim information as described in relevant dictated and/or written documentation for the purpose of coding and abstracting all mandatory claim data required to:complete a claim abstract in compliance with nwisp (national work injury statistics program) standards and guidelines; support internal reporting and other strategic organizational initiatives, and; support ontario ministry of labor (mol) information requirements. as an integral part of the rdm (reference data management) team, the claims information specialist utilizes their technical, analytical and decision-making skills to communicate with different stakeholders to exchange information and serve as subject-matter expert on coding-related issues.major duties and responsibilities: 1.   coding and abstractingdiagnosis coding


		interprets and determines all relevant conditions (nature of injury) and affected part(s) of body described by the ill or injured worker, employer, health providers, and/or case managers associated with the claim being reviewed

		evaluates conditions to determine severity and appropriately assign significance using diagnosis-typing conventions

		diagnosis code selection using approved coding classification system (eg. csa-z795, icd9/icd10)

		utilization of an electronic codebook to search for appropriate codes taking into account all inclusion and exclusion criteria

		sequences codes appropriately to facilitate data submission and reporting

		assigns appropriate diagnosis categories on disease claims

		collect additional diagnosis information such as pre-existing conditions, co-morbidities, late effects, sequela and complications

injury/disease information coding


		interprets relevant source documents to determine the “event” which describes the manner in which the injury or disease was produced or inflicted by the identified “source” of injury or disease

		interprets relevant source documents to determine the “source” which identifies the object, substance, exposure or bodily motion that directly produced or inflicted the injury or disease identified under the nature of injury or disease

		utilization of an electronic codebook to search for appropriate codes taking into account all inclusion and exclusion criteria

		identifies correct accident location (standardized geographic codes) and accident place

worker information coding


		identifies primary and/or secondary occupation associated with the claim using approved occupational classification system (noc and/or soc).  selection of appropriate occupation impacts strategic planning and program reviews

		collects information on ill or injured worker’s years of experience, work start hours and work end hours

fatality coding


		identifies and collects relevant fatality-related information such as cause of death and external cause (e-code)

exposure information coding


		identifies and determines appropriate primary and secondary exposures described in the source documents

		collects exposure years

other pertinent information


		verifies and collects other relevant claim information such as cancer morphology, smoking status, smoking amount, and project id

2.   performs data quality management responsibilities


		performs data quality review on individual claim records and evaluates claim information from multiple sources to ensure accuracy, consistency, and completeness of information

		communicates with appropriate business areas whenever there are discrepancies and/or vague descriptions stated in the claim documentation

		interacts with data quality analyst(s) and/or senior business analyst(s) to discuss data quality issues and provide input on how to improve reporting and flagging of cases

		performs data reconciliation on cases that are important to reporting at the close of each month.  examples include, but are not limited to, the following:  traumatic mental stress, cancers, high impact claims, and fatality claims

		participates in data quality exercises and coding discrepancy identification and resolution

		participate in the development and implementation of departmental policies to ensure data is gathered and tracked efficiently

3.   performs case studies and chart audits


		engages in an interactive and iterative process to independently review a selected claim record and chooses appropriate diagnosis and accident information codes based on understanding of national coding standards

		participates in continuous quality improvement (cqi) at provincial and national level

4.   maintains professional expertise and credentials


		him professionals are required by chima to acquire a minimum of 36 continuing professional education (cpe) credits in a period of three years to maintain their credentials and professional standing

		cpe credits are acquired through taking him-related courses, attending seminars, conferences, workshops, and completing learning modules

5.   maintains and protects worker confidentiality at all times.6.   client engagement


		educate/support staff members from different business areas in accessing coding information in aces

		provide coding information expertise and guidance to business partners, projects and initiatives

		effectively organize and present coding information/directives to interested parties

7.   performs other related duties and responsibilities as assigned or required.job requirements:


		post secondary diploma up to three years in health information management and a canadian health information management (chima) certification

		5 years experience in healthcare-information

		5 year experience in business analytics  







 as a precondition of employment, the wsib will require a prospective candidate to undergo a criminal records name check prior to or at any time following hire. to apply for this position, please submit your application by the closing date noted above. we appreciate the interest of all candidates.  due to the volumes of applications we receive, we are only able to contact candidates that are selected to move forward in the recruitment process. the wsib is an equal opportunity employer.  accommodation is available under the ontario human rights code.


privacy statement

personal information will be collected from your resume, application, cover letter and references under the authority of the workplace safety and insurance act, 1997 and will be used by the talent acquisition centre and wsib hiring parties to assess/validate your qualifications and/or determine if you meet the requirements of vacant positions and/or gather information relevant for recruitment purposes. if you have questions or concerns regarding the collection and use of your personal information, contact the wsib privacy office, 200 front street west, toronto, on, m5v 3j1 or 416-344-5323 or 1-800-387-0750 extension 5323.  be advised that information related to application status will not be provided.

cibc is a leading canadian-based global financial institution. through our three major businesses – retail and business banking, wealth management and capital markets – we provide a full range of financial products and services to 11 million individual, small business, commercial, corporate and institutional clients in canada and around the world. we invest in our businesses, our clients, our people and our communities to deliver consistent and sustainable earnings to our shareholders.  to learn more about cibc’s lines of business, please visit our website. 
 
cibc delivers access to career and development opportunities, safe and healthy workplaces, effective training, and positive work-life balance – so that employees are able to perform at their best, contribute to their communities and focus on cultivating deeper relationships with our clients.
 
every year, cibc is recognized for its business success, community commitment and employee initiatives.  we are proud of this success and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace and an environment where all employees can excel. 
 
to learn more about cibc and the cibc group of companies please visit cibc.com.  
 
the compliance department's objective is to achieve its mandate and to help business group leaders fulfill their regulatory compliance responsibilities while, at the same time, enabling them to achieve their business goals. together with the business groups, and in line with cibc's risk appetite statement, compliance works to manage and mitigate regulatory compliance risk while building a strong, innovative and relationship-oriented bank, to protect cibc's reputation and brand, and to help cibc succeed in its mission. compliance strives to do so in a manner that is consistent with cibc's values of trust, teamwork and accountability. 
the compliance department's objective is to achieve its mandate and to help business group leaders fulfill their regulatory compliance responsibilities while, at the same time, enabling them to achieve their business goals. together with the business groups, and in line with cibc's risk appetite statement, compliance works to manage and mitigate regulatory compliance risk while building a strong, innovative and relationship-oriented bank, to protect cibc's reputation and brand, and to help cibc succeed in its mission. compliance strives to do so in a manner that is consistent with cibc's values of trust, teamwork and accountability. 
 
job overview 
 
reporting to the director of capital markets compliance, the position (compliance officer/ data analyst) will be responsible for conducting daily review of conduct via trading and sales activity and for identification of suspicious or unusual transactions or trading patterns or sales, which may suggest a breach of cibc’s information barrier procedures, policies or regulatory requirements. the incumbent will investigate, document and report such transactions and recommend appropriate courses of action to compliance management for consideration. the position will also be responsible for reviewing processes to identify and recommend improvements with a focus on data analytics and automation.
 
what you’ll be doing


develop or augment tools  to query data and work on database design with internal partners with an understanding of compliance mandate and financial products.
collaborate with other team members in creating efficiency by developing automation tools for manual processes.

analyze project and technical risk plans for possible short-term initiatives and recommend opportunities for enhancement, ensuring alignment with department’s goals and objectives.

apply a variety of analysis to interpret data and identify patterns.investigate, compile, document, and prepare information for regulatory inquiries using adp and smarts, and smarts data base, cognos, bloomberg, postedge, iress, ices, trs and emc records. 
conduct testing for compliance with designated umir, tse, ats and me requirements and cibc policies and procedures, escalating any non-compliance to compliance management. 
what we’re looking for 

must be highly proficient in the use of microsoft excel, access and sql querying with a minimum of 3 years of relevant technical expertise. must be able to write simple to complex macros in excel with strong knowledge of sql queries to automate multiple use of different programs. 
bachelor’s degree or equivalent in mathematics or computer science would be considered an asset.
knowledge of equity and equity derivatives trading practices and market structure issues gained at an investment dealer, regulator or marketplace would be considered an asset.
knowledge of fixed income, foreign exchange and/or derivatives trading practices gained at a financial institution or regulator would be considered an asset. 
detailed working knowledge of the activities of the capital markets division of a financial institution sufficient to interpret, analyze and apply relevant issues and developments in creative ways to day-to-day issues
working knowledge of compliance practices, procedures and principles to perform in-depth analysis of trading transactions, including non-routine and sensitive situations would be considered an asset
ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of a team
strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate and influence assertively, clearly and concisely, both in writing and verbally
willingness to continuously upgrade skills
ability to work with many interruptions, switch gears quickly and balance competing priorities 
what cibc can offer you 

flexible health benefits, stock purchase options, competitive incentive pay and recognition programs
competitive salary and banking benefits 
career growth, development and continuous learning opportunities
opportunity to be involved in cibc events that help our communities
click to learn more about rewards & recognition, learning & development, and employee community involvement 
what you should know

must be legally eligible to work in canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work permit or study permit that allows the candidate to fulfill the requirements of the role.

						welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job basket|sign inbmocareers.support@bmo.comthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy job pagebasic search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - senior manager, strategic analytics (1700016398)job description senior manager, strategic analytics-1700016398description the senior manager, strategic analytics (credit risk) role is an ideal opportunity to be part of a growing and dynamic team in a collaborative environment that supports personal segment of the bank. personal segment (part of p&c canada) is an important segment of the bank with 25% of the bank’s assets. the incumbent will have high visibility to senior management and will be a recognized contributor who impacts the client experience and the bank’s results. 
 
the senior manager, strategic analytics works with business, technology & operations, enterprise risk teams and data base partners to lead the design, development, and implementation of analytics solutions that drive measurable business outcomes and create a distinctive customer experience.  the senior manager, strategic analytics plays a key role in influencing the data architecture and data repository build for future analytical needs, providing thought leadership and insights from new data for strategies and  conducting research and analysis, generating ideas, structuring data and building predictive models and solutions.
 
this is an exciting opportunity that is on the forefront of a critical enterprise capability, providing thought leadership to the enterprise on the value of data and analytics.  the incumbent will get to work with and support multiple lines of business to help them achieve their objectives.
 
this role could also be quite attractive for a past data scientist who has performed big data analytics on large volumes and wide varieties of data.  the role would permit the incumbent to be engaged on both the business and technology side and will use analytics to provide additional insight to our environment and provide intelligence that will act as a catalyst of change.
 

leveraging data to drive insights and recommendation on variables that can be used to improve credit decisions 

selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using advanced modeling techniques 
data mining using state-of-the-art methods 
doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
 

building prediction models to help improve credit decisioning with objective to provide better customer experience 

creating regression based models to help improve credit decisioning 
leveraging machine learning and/or other advanced analytical techniques to improve current prediction models 
building high quality analytic solutions that are intuitive for senior audiences, simple to maintain, and drive real business outcomes
 

supporting the data infrastructure and data repository build for retail business including risk reporting and analytics 

represent the risk team for the build of data infrastructure for risk reporting and analytics. champion the process/ partner with relevant retail business stakeholders to guide the infrastructure build for retail 
extending company’s data with third party sources of information when needed 
enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems across retail business 
processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
 

manages key relationships with partners to build a lasting foundation of trust and advice 

work with partners in business, technology & operations, enterprise risk teams and data base partners
 

contributing to building an enterprise community of data & analytics practitioners to facilitate best practice sharing and support.qualifications knowledge:

university degree in business/commerce, data sciences, engineering, finance and/or mathematics (graduate level degrees preferred) and/or 7 to 10 years of experience in analytics, finance and/or consulting. 
advanced knowledge of design and analysis methodologies to work in an agile development environment. 
experience with common data science toolkits, such as r, python, etc. . excellence in at least one of these is highly desirable. 
experience with data visualisation tools, such as spotfire, tableau etc. 
proficiency in using query languages such as sql, sas
skills:

exhibits advanced analytical, critical thinking skills, and integrative skills. 
demonstrates solid communication skills (both written and verbal) and relationship management skills at a senior management level. 
demonstrates ability to build a good fact base, apply sound reasoning, and generate relevant recommendations that get implemented and lead to business success. 
demonstrates innovative thinking and creativity. 
is able to handle multiple priorities. 
is able to work highly independently and work successfully with a team that has diverse skills, knowledge, and educational backgrounds.

we’re here to help
 
at bmo we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our dna. for 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. we help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.
 
as a member of the bmo team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. we strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. we’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. from in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
 
to find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com.

section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - data scientist – customer insights (pla03239-17)job description data scientist – customer insights - pla03239-17description position overview:   the performance analysis consultant is an expert/advisory level position. as performance analysis consultant – customer 360 insights within the journey design & delivery team, this candidate will be reporting to manager, c360 insights. the candidate will be responsible for providing actionable customer insights to resolve strategic and tactical marketing issues by building advanced statistical models using sas, sql and other data mining tools. the role would be expected to provide thought-leadership in researching new modeling techniques/solutions to solve complex marketing issues. along with the manager, c360 insights, the candidate will co-lead the integration of customer insights into telus’ omni channel marketing strategy to enable better decisions that drive revenue/ebitda growth, manage churn and reduce customer effort across various lines of business.   responsibilities:  strategies and planning:  assist the manager, c360 insights to cultivate a fact-based-data-driven decision making culture inside and outside the marketing department and implement the best-in-class end-to-end modeling process to gain operational efficiency assist the manager, c360 insight to identify business issues through analytics; provide actionable insights and influence business partners to take action based on analytical/modeling insights   thought leadership and teamwork:  contribute to the ongoing development of the team by sharing information, success, lessons learned of own project work collaboratively with marketing primes to develop modelling requirements and prioritization; present model results and actionable recommendations to internal business clients and senior leadership mentors junior team members from a technical as well as business acumen perspective assist the manager, c360 insights to drive for the cultivation of a hybrid culture (analytics and business) to share insights/learnings to demonstrate value of big data analytics and investments to business partner teams (data - insights - strategy - results)   day-to-day portfolio/deliverable management:  contribute to the development of the omni channel strategy by developing near real-time predictive models and trigger based strategies leveraging sas/sas enterprise miner, hive, spark, python, r, etc work collaboratively with business partners teams to understand, compartmentalize complex and ambiguous business issues into crisp and manageable pieces develop analytical blueprint to solve compartmentalized business issues and assembly to the big picture solution present customer insights to cross functional business partners including marketing, channel, products & services, customer experience and digital own the end-to-end development of campaign targeting through analytics and building propensity models/response models using various multivariate modelling/data mining techniques   expert knowledge:  be recognized as the top expert in predictive modeling, data mining, r&d within telus educate, advocate and advise cross-functional business partners at team member level in advanced analytics and predictive modeling maintain a solid and updated knowledge in the predictive modeling, data mining field including applications of big data, text analytics, social network analytics, cross channel modelling   qualifications required knowledge:  business orientation:  advanced business acumen, relationship management and influencing without authority skills; ability to provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis strong ability to prioritize tasks from multiple stakeholders and meet deadlines with quality deliverables advanced written, oral, communications, presentation skills and knowledge of microsoft office suite   technical expertise:  advanced knowledge in various advanced predictive modeling/data mining techniques to ensure effective solutions to marketing issues extensive hands-on experience in sas (or sas enterprise guide), sas enterprise miner, hive, spark, r, python, sql and other data query language on unix/pc and comfortable working with very large data sets and databases strong quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills    required skills & abilities:  change management: self-driven individual with ability to adapt to varying business environments and effectively drive business results by leveraging analytics mentorship: strong leadership, coaching, mentoring skills  required professional designation/certification:  phd in statistics, economics, mathematics, computer science or other quantitative field is preferred master’s degree with extensive relevant experience and knowledge will be strongly considered  required experience:  10+ years of related predictive modeling experience, preferably in marketing telecom/industry experience would be beneficial credit risk modeling experience will be considered  who is telus?    we're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make telus one of the leading telecommunications companies in canada. our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and optik tv™. we also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.   everyone belongs at telus. it doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at telus, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.   do you share our passion?       at telus, you create future friendly® possibilities.   at telus, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. primary location: ca-on-torontoschedule: full-timeaccessibilitytelus is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. we are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

title: Data Scientist
text:
407 etr | career



skip to content






























search





































career opportunities







data scientist


location:
headquarters


job code:
504


# of openings:
2



description
position summary:
the successful candidate will assist in leveraging customer, digital and transportation datasets to create insights on pricing, marketing and customer behavior. the data scientist will assist the director of data analytics and other key stakeholders to bring actionable data driven solutions to 407etr. this job involves model design, data management, data queries, and providing input into programs and policies. this position is part of a highly collaborative and energetic team in a start-up minded environment.
position responsibility:

assemble and analyze data to understand customer behavior from existing 407 etr data, external data sources and emerging sources.


undertake analysis of target customer groups (segments) for specific marketing and pricing programs and assess opportunities and strategies for marketing.
ad hoc analysis and modeling of data.
ability to understand business stakeholder’s issues and create valuable insight.
raise awareness and action of data science within the company to help focus on fact based decisions.
support the department along with the information technology management department in planning the structure and storage of new customer related data fields.
represent the department in committees within the organization.

qualifications:

a university degree in engineering, statistics, mathematics, or computer science.


minimum 5 years working experience with data science techniques: clustering, regression models, classification, anomaly detection and other machine learning techniques.
minimum 5 years of experience with data analysis tools (eg. sas, r or python) and bi visualization for reporting.
well-developed business analysis, research and creative problem solving skills.
organizational skills and time management skills; planning and project management, and ability to meet multiple deadlines.
strong communication skills and work ethic.
highly collaborative team player with an entrepreneurial spirit.
familiarity with microstrategy is an asset.

note: this job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.
accommodations for disabilities or other grounds protected by human rights legislation are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the employment selection process.

data scientist, data & analytics






toronto, on 


job description


working at kpmg allows you to gain valuable on-the-job experience while building your professional network and business acumen. being part of the kpmg global member firm of 155 countries and 174,000 professionals, you’ll be part of a high performing team and have access to ongoing professional development and mentorship at every level. you will work with national and global organizations, adding value and gaining valuable on-the-job experience. at kpmg, we’ll provide you with the support to drive your own career and discover the countless opportunities available. position summary our data and analytics practice is a strategic growth initiative for kpmg and it is growing rapidly. we provide clients with d&a solutions which range from the foundational to very advanced. we often help clients with first-of-a-kind capabilities which helps them transform and become leaders in their space. our innovation driven growth provides practitioners lots of opportunity to learn and develop. d&a practitioners are expected to be proficient on several of the following capabilities and are expected to work on engagements, which will include one or more of the following: help our clients transform in a digital world: business and analytics strategy to adapt to changes resulting from technological advances, disruption of business models and data monetizationartificial intelligence and automation: develop intelligent bots to help eliminate bias, human error, and inefficiency in decision making.virtual and augmented reality and the internet of things: understand and articulate how technologies such as these are changing the world. prototype and develop solutions which include vr/ar and iot which change user experience, business models and much moreanalytical enterprise: enabling people with tools, process and governanceinformation management: building trust in the data they use and report, as well as how it is managed and storeddata engineering and big data: ensuring architecture is scalable and flexible to business changereporting & visualization: identifying the right kpis, dashboard to help effectively monitor performance and enable insight discoveryadvanced analytics: enabling greater insight into business drivers and future outlook to proactively inform business decisions using supervised and unsupervised techniques read here to know more about: kpmg data & analytics role & responsibilitieswork closely with clients in understanding key business issues. gather and analyze requirements to develop impactful recommendations and solutionsutilize advanced analytical techniques to solve challenging business problems. propose and develop results, models and rules engines using statistical, machine learning, natural language processing, linear programming, etc.work with large volumes of data (structured and unstructured). investigate and perform deeper analysis to produce impactful algorithms to achieve targeted outcomesperform quantitative analysis of data issuescome to work with an intrinsic desire to change your worldinspire a very smart and talented team to be better at what they already do and innovate in new areaslead engagements and teams to successful outcomes with a focus on problem solving and executionunderstand the business challenge, the data points associated with that scenario and be able to formulate solutions through the application of people, process, technology and databe a thought leader in your area of expertise skills & qualifications:an insatiable curiosity to learn, an aptitude to figure it out and a hunger to make a differencestrong communication and interpersonal skillsability to think critically and laterally – problem solve and innovate within a team environment high level of attention to detail, excellent time management skills, ability to perform under pressurepost-secondary education equivalent to a university degree in numerate or analytical disciplines such as mathematics, computer science, or engineering. (candidates with the equivalent of a master’s degree in a relevant subject including, but not limited to mathematics, science, engineering, business administration, marketing, operational research, economics, statistics , ai, computer science or a related field etc. will be preferred.) technical skills:a successful track record of leading large scale data driven engagements within integrated, multi-disciplinary project teamsproven data extraction, analysis, cleansing, quality and manipulation skills, as well as experience handling very large volumes of datawell versed with the software development lifecycle, product management, principles of software engineering or data mining methodologiesextensive experience with standard statistical packages or languages (r, python, matlab, sas, spss, etc.)proficiency in scripting (perl, powershell, etc.) experience with programming languages such as (python, java, c, c++, etc.)prior exposure to tools like alteryx, tableau, spotfire, powerbi, etc.experience with hadoop (hdfs, hive, pig, informatica, erwin, etc.), databases (sql server, oracle, etc.), solution definition and application, and  methods (sdlc, pmlc)experience with embedded os for iot is a plusexperience with microsoft hololens is a plusproficient in microsoft powerpoint, excel, access and wordhaving fun is key to our productivity and creativity and we provide access to cool relaxation gadgets. we enjoy our work and work hard with a relentless focus on quality and success. at times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this. #li-143683426_ak1

our values, the kpmg way

we lead by example | we work together | we respect the individual  we seek the facts and provide insight | we are open and honest in our communication  we are committed to our communities | above all, we act with integritykpmg is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. kpmg encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. if you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the hr shared service centre by email at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or by phone at 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 (option 1). kpmg will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

title: 
                        
senior manager, digital data & reporting- toronto,on
                        









 

requisition id: 3914
join the global community of scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
 
purpose of job
the senior manager, data & reporting analyst is responsible for creating reports and analytics results that track performance in key areas such as digital customer adoption, usage and sales. this role acts as the digital data sme in performing technical data analysis, producing monthly reports and being the group’s data representative. through data etl and working closely with various data teams and enterprise data warehouse / data lake, this role updates key digital data in databases and maintains data integrity. outside of regular data/reporting deliverables, this role also provides trending analysis, data-backed insight, as well as supports campaign measurement and new functionality development support towards the bank’s digital transformation objectives.

major accountabilities
 

works with various data teams, enterprise data warehouse and data lake to ensure month-end data production runs in orderly fashion, and address/resolve data anomalies
performs data pulls from various sources (sql and non sql) and maintain data integrity through data validation and auditing
tracks customer adoption, usage and sales for multiple digital channels (scotiaonline, mobile apps, mobile web) and identifies underlying trends and behaviours
independently creates various reports and dashboards for the needs of broad audience, includes executives, enterprise strategy, digital organization, operation teams, etc.
updates existing mis data systems with digital data
prepares ad-hoc reports and analysis based on needs
explores and accesses new data from various platforms, and ensure proper incorporation of any new data feeds
interprets analytics results and presents findings to upper management team
performs measurement of digital marketing campaigns, new product development and new customer experience functionalities
participates in future development and improvement of mis systems that might involve sas/sql, as400, hadoop/hive and other data and reporting systems
identifies and deliver new means of enhancing business intelligence and analytics


education/work experience

bachelor degree in computer science, mathematics, digital marketing, business, or related fields
5-7 years of proven track record in data analytics or technical disciplines in financial or telecommunication industry
python, spark, r with skills in sas and sql coding skills
extended experience in analyzing customer, transaction and sales data
in-depth understanding of digital delivery channels (mobile, online, abm, etc.)
experience in analytical/statistics tools (eg. excel, alteryx, r)
experience in graphing/visualization tools (eg. powerpoint, tableau)
exposure in data management platforms (eg. db2, hadoop, cloud solutions)
passionate about data, digital innovations and cutting-edge technology
excellent communication (written and verbal) and presentation skill

 
location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. we are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

database, telecom, telecommunications, bank, banking, technology, finance

title: HR Analytics & Compensation Specialist
text:
career center






























new search
                       
                    


login page
                       
                    














position description











 



hr analytics & compensation specialist




location


toronto




job code


87




# of openings


1




apply now
cmls financial, one of canada’s largest mortgage lenders and technology innovators, is currently seeking a professional, energetic, and tech-savvy hr analytics & compensation specialist in either our vancouver or toronto office to provide expertise on a variety of hr programs and services, specifically concentrating on compensation, benefits and reporting.  reporting to the senior director, human resources and working closely with the hr and management teams, you will act in an advisory capacity for compensation review, analysis of market trends, managing of the semi-monthly payroll and benefits program and provide various reporting to multiple stakeholders. the hr analytics & compensation specialist will be results-oriented, accurate with a strong attention to detail and demonstrates a high degree of accountability.  it is expected that you will work with the hr team on a variety of activities, including the following: recruitment, orientation, performance management, employee relations and employee communications. 
 
our successful candidate will possess superior communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to manage their time effectively while completing high-quality work in a fast-paced environment. this is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced hr professional to truly become a strategic business partner and have a tremendous impact. you will find success based on your abilities in the following areas:
50% of your time will be spent on managing compensation programs, the payroll and benefits function and reporting. working with our leaders and the hr team:


you will manage compensation, including working closely with the managed payroll provider and act as the owner of the semi-monthly salary processing, as well as employee and government inquiries.  working directly with the senior director on compensation plan design and pay-bands based on market compensation trends.


you will own the benefits function, including working closely with our benefits consultants and act as the owner of the benefit plan processing (enrollments, employee changes, and monthly reconciliations).  you will handle inquiries about benefits and acts as the hr team liaison for matters involving the finance team and the benefits consultants. 


you will complete all document management and reporting requirements for various stakeholders, including maintaining accurate, up-to-date, and complete employee records and hr information and related record systems in compliance with applicable legislation. you will complete scheduled and ad-hoc reporting and analysis related to employee data and compensation.


 
25% of your time will be spent on supporting individuals, managers and the hr team by:


supporting hr projects and other functional areas as required in accordance to the hr cycle including but not limited to establishing pay bands, supporting the teams with salary reviews, compliance and industry best practices; recommend changes and modifications to existing policies and programs to remain in compliance and adopt best practices where applicable.


becoming an innovator with great ideas for our team(s): as an hr team, work on a variety of special projects and initiatives that drive excellent people management practices, awesome company culture and mitigate risk and foster open communication.


 
25% of your time will be spent supporting the hr team: 


support process review to identify gaps, enhancements, and efficiencies for the hr team 


support hr technology implementations and modifications to drive workflows, automation, and audit controls


during hr technology implementations, the allocation to the work assignment could be as high as 50% of your time. 


 
this role is for you if:


you completed a university degree in business administration, industrial relations, commerce or psychology, with a professional designation (such as cphr considered an asset). payroll certification is an asset. 


you have a minimum of 3-5 years of experience as an hr generalist in various functions with specialization in compensation and benefits. experience in managing the processing of salaries, bonuses, commissions, and other forms of compensation.


you possess advanced technical skills using microsoft applications including office, excel, visio, sharepoint, and powerpivot which will be essential for success.


you have advanced knowledge of payroll systems, internal controls, and management including advising, recommending and implementing new hris systems.


you have experience managing projects with excellent knowledge of organization design, human resource practices and performance measurements practices.


you are exceptionally client focus and service orientated, with demonstrated leadership and the ability to establish and maintain relationships with both management and staff.


you have proven ability in collaborating and partnering with the business.


you are flexible and interested in working for a growing and fast-paced organization.


who are we?
we are canada’s mortgage company. founded in 1974, cmls financial is one of canada’s largest, independently owned mortgage services companies. we currently originate over $2.5 billion of commercial mortgages each year and since 2013, have helped over 10,000 canadians achieve their dream of homeownership.
learn more at www.cmls.ca or check out our careers page on linkedin.
 
you will love working here:
employees tell us that they love that we strike the balance in creating an incredibly professional, yet dynamic and enjoyable corporate culture. we work in a fluid and fast-paced environment that is supportive of energetic and motivated individuals who pride themselves on being flexible and results-driven. our employees get valuable industry knowledge and experience and have the opportunity to an impactful career with cmls. we are committed to providing our people with a challenging and rewarding career because our employees are what set us apart and we know it.

business intelligence and analytics manager
 
at j.d. irving, limited, you are part of an energetic team of professionals who lead with integrity and are passionate about achieving results.  with a culture that nurtures talent and creates an inclusive workplace, you can grow your career across our diverse operating divisions.
summary of ideal candidate:

self-starter with ability to design, develop and implement a wide range of cognos solutions
work independently or as part of a team
excellent written and verbal communication skills
strong customer focus and delivery
highest education level / certifications required:

bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathmatics, operations management or a related field
minimum 5 years experience in a directly related area
extensive expertise in key toolsets (cognos, tableau, ersi gis) with a solid understanding of key bi trends
strong database understanding
experience managing large complex bi projects and teams
a solid understanding of mobile delivery architecture and best practices
responsibilities:

strategy development, building the execution plan and managing the day-to-day operations of the bi team
responsible for all operational, financial, technical and resource management responsibilities associated with:

master data management
what are they day to day responsibilities?
reporting, analytics, data exploration
bi compentency center
data preparation (sourcing, acqusision, integration)
bi governance
information delivery (portals, mobile)
advance/predictive analytics
 
to apply for this career opportunity:
 
please apply online by october 31st, 2017.
 
we appreciate your interest in our company!  the initial review of applications will happen on an on-going basis. applications received after the deadline may not be considered.  only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
