reference number: tbd17j-014677-003246selection process number: 2017-tbd-ea-ba-102962-01



	treasury board of canada secretariat
	
 	- expenditure management sector
	

























ottawa (ontario)














ec-03, ec-04





	
	




  indeterminate and determinate





	
	ec-03 salary: $63,428 to $71,769 and ec-04 salary: $68,468 to $79,234



	for further information on the organization, please visit treasury board of canada secretariat
closing date:


	
	10 october 2017 - 23:59, pacific time
	

who can apply:




 
 
persons residing in canada and canadian citizens residing abroad. 
 
 





















apply online


important messages
note that this advertisement was originally posted as selection process number: 2017-tbd-ea-ba-102962.only applications received directly via the system (https://www.canada.ca/en/public-service-commission/jobs/services/public-service-jobs.html) will be accepted. if you require accommodation for any reason, you must contact the hr advisor listed below before the closing date. if you do not clearly demonstrate how you meet all screening criteria, your application will be rejected. your application may also be rejected if it has incomplete information. we will not contact you to request information that is missing from your application
work environmentare you a data-driven problem solver with a solid foundation in math or computer science? are you intellectually curious, self-motivated, and possess strong business acumen? the treasury board of canada secretariat is looking for motivated data scientists to join a multidisciplinary team dedicated to improving transparency and openness in government reporting through the tbs infobase—a searchable online database providing financial and human resources information on government of canada operations.the successful candidate will, among other things, work to create data visualizations and new data systems, integrate existing data systems to create intelligence, use new technologies to extract more value from existing data and automate analysis which is currently done manually.the treasury board of canada secretariat (tbs) is a central agency located in the national capital region. working at tbs offers a unique opportunity to contribute to the work of a central federal agency, and to be part of cultivating the federal public service as a model workplace. with high-performing teams and innovative practices, tbs professionals in various fields serve canadians by collaborating on government-wide initiatives, driving excellence in people management and taking initiative while effectively managing risks.if you are a leader, a motivator and a strategic thinker who wants to work for one of canada’s top employers, consider joining the tbs team.
intent of the process

		anticipatory process - a pool of qualified persons resulting from this process will be created and may be used to fill similar positions with linguistic profiles (english essential, french essential, bilingual imperative bbb/bbb, bilingual imperative cbc/cbc, bilingual non-imperative bbb/bbb, bilingual non-imperative cbc/cbc) as well as tenures (indeterminate, deployment, acting, assignment, secondment, specified period) which may vary according to the position being staffed.this pool will be used to staff similar positions in other organizations within the core public administration (http://www.psc-cfp.gc.ca/plcy-pltq/rfli-lirf/index-eng.htm).by applying to this process, you consent to your personal application-related information being shared with other government departments interested in staffing similar positions.



positions to be filled:





number to be determined







information you must provide

  
  
    your résumé.
  

  
  

  
  

  
  
  
  

  
  

  
  

  you must meet all essential qualifications in order to be appointed to the position. other qualifications may be a deciding factor in choosing the person to be appointed. some essential and other qualifications will be assessed through your application. it is your responsibility to provide appropriate examples that illustrate how you meet each qualification. failing to do so could result in your application being rejected.

in order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)education:graduation with a degree from a recognized post-secondary institution with acceptable specialization in economics, sociology or statistics.candidates must always have a degree. the courses* for the specialization must be acceptable and may have been taken at a recognized post-secondary institution, but not necessarily within a degree program in the required specialization. the specialization may also be obtained through an acceptable combination of education, training and/or experience.*note that the course requirement can be attained in programs such as: mathematics, computer science, data science/data analytics, accounting, demography/population studies, environmental sciences, epidemiology, geology, and/or finance.degree equivalencyexperience common to both streams:-experience in large scale* data management, validation, cleaning and categorizing as well as database development, data mining and data analysis, including recent** experience with tools such as python, r, sas, or sql.*large scale is based on data records numbering in the thousands or above.**recent is defined as experience normally acquired within the last three (3) years.the following will be applied / assessed at a later date (essential for the job)various language requirements-bilingual imperative bbb/bbb and cbc/cbc;-bilingual non-imperative bbb/bbb and cbc/cbc;-english essential;-french essential.information on language requirementsec-03 stream:experience in any one (1) of the following: -recent** experience using programming languages (such as python, r, javascript, ruby or sas) to develop data visualizations;-experience undertaking research and analysis to produce reports summarizing empirical findings;-experience in using machine learning methodologies to solve problems.ec-04 stream:-recent** experience in using programming languages (python, r, javascript, ruby, or sas) to develop data visualizations;-experience in undertaking research and analysis to produce reports summarizing empirical findings;-experience in using machine learning methodologies to solve problems. **recent is defined as experience normally acquired within the last three (3) years.knowledge:-knowledge of programming languages (such as python, r, javascript, ruby, sas, or sql) and techniques used to analyze and present complex data to non-technical audiences.abilities:-ability to analyze and present complex data to non-technical audiences using programming languages and related techniques;-ability to build and maintain professional relationships;-ability to communicate effectively in writing;-ability to communicate effectively orally.personal suitability:-creative thinking;-reliability; -flexibility;-initiative.the following may be applied / assessed at a later date (may be needed for the job)asset qualificationseducation:one or more of the following:(1) a graduate or post-graduate degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial mathematics, data science, computer science, applied finance, or engineering.(2) university-level courses in any of the following: -data mining;-data warehousing;-business intelligence and data visualizations; -data analytics;-geo-spatial analysis. (3) certifications relevant to the field including:-chartered public accountant (cpa);-chartered financial analyst (cfa);-certified analytics professional (cap);-cloudera certified professional: data scientist (ccp:ds);-emc: data science associate (emcdsa).degree equivalencyexperience:-recent* experience working with the wet (web experience toolkit) and wcag 2.0 guidelines for accessibility;-experience in policy development or program delivery in an area that spans the government of canada’s responsibilities (e.g. infrastructure, it infrastructure, procurement, indigenous peoples, veterans, students, etc.);-experience working with government of canada expenditure management or people management data;-experience working with unstructured data such as text, social media, video feeds or audio;-recent* experience working in a collaborative developer/information technology (it) professional environment to automate the process of software delivery and infrastructure changes (for example dev ops);-experience working with big data including use of technologies such as distributed calculation, distributed databases, and hadoop;-experience in developing and supporting the implementation of business rules, standards, policies, guidelines or processes related to one or more of the following: data access, creation, production, storage, dissemination or evaluation of data/metadata;-working with and structuring large scale** geo-coded data for analysis and presentation;-experience working with any of the following: spss, java, perl, c/c++, hadoop, d3, shiny, tableau, and/or powerbi.*recent is defined as experience normally acquired within the last three (3) years.**large scale is based on data records numbering in the thousands or above.organizational needs:-treasury board secretariat employees affected by workforce adjustment may be appointed before persons employed by other government organizations.-in support of achieving a diverse workforce, consideration may be given to candidates self-identifying as belonging to one of the following employment equity groups: aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and women.operational requirements: -willingness to work overtime on short notice;-willingness to travel occasionally.conditions of employmentvarious security levels: -reliability status security clearance;-secret security clearance.
other information
we will communicate with you about this process by email. as a result, you must update your public service resourcing system profile if it changes. applicants should use an email address that accepts messages from unknown senders (some email systems block such messages).if you do not respond to our communications, we will interpret this as your withdrawal from the process.candidates may be required to meet the asset qualifications or the organizational needs, depending on the requirements of the specific position being staffed.reference checks will be sought.an interview will be administered.a test will be administered.please identify clearly for which position(s) you are submitting an application.you must provide proof of your education credentials.persons are entitled to participate in the appointment process in the official language of their choice.you must indicate on your application if you require a technical aid for testing or an alternative method of assessment.
the public service of canada is committed to building a skilled, diverse workforce reflective of canadian society. as a result, it promotes employment equity and encourages candidates to indicate voluntarily on their application if they are a woman, an aboriginal person, a person with a disability or a member of a visible minority group.
the public service of canada is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. if contacted in relation to a job opportunity or testing, you should advise the public service commission or the departmental official in a timely fashion of the accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

preference will be given to veterans and to canadian citizens, in that order.

associate manager, business analytics and insights





marketing

pickering , ontario


posted on:
september 27, 2017












purdue pharma canada's is investing in our pipeline which will diversify and add multiple products to our portfolio over the coming years. our portfolio diversification strategy is gaining momentum and the strong foundation we have built over the last 60 years in canada, allows us to forge ahead with bold plans for the next 60 years. 
you have an opportunity to play a key role in this success story as our:
associate manager, business analytics and insights
position summary:
 
the associate manager’s role is to be a strategic partner and provider of market information to the commercial team to help meet corporate objectives through identification of value added insights that will help impact strategy and business results. the primary objective of this position is to develop and maintain secondary market research reports, and interpret findings for current and future products. the position will be working with the other associate managers, business analytics and insights in other commercial activities such as: primary market research, forecasting, brand planning and ad-hoc requests. this role will work closely with the business development (bd) team contributing to the growth of purdue’s product portfolio through the identification, analysis and supporting the acquisition of products and technologies across therapy and disease areas of interest.
responsibilities: 

foster strong working relationships with key internal stakeholders such as sales, marketing, market access, business development and financial partners to meet project and corporate objectives as assigned 
assist in primary market research activities for current and pipeline products, including research design, vendor engagement, implementation, analysis and presentation of results 
a major portion of this role involves responsibility for assigned secondary research activities (primarily using ims and internal data) for marketed and pipeline products; this includes significant time devoted to hands-on data extraction, manipulation, analysis, interpretation and presentation 
synthesis and communication of both primary and secondary research findings into actionable insights to positively impact sales and marketing activities 
monitor marketplace and product performance trends; generate scheduled and ad hoc data reports as well as provide business analytics and strategic insights 
develop and maintain confidential data warehouses and reporting systems (e.g. dashboards) 
provide support in ad-hoc market analyses for business development and market access opportunities 
assist in the development of short and long-term sales forecasts 
provide input into marketing plans and development of corporate presentations 

qualifications: 

bachelor’s degree in business and/or science
up to 3 years of business analytics and insights experience. pharmaceutical experience preferred
thorough understanding of and expertise in modern market research methodologies
good teamwork skills, initiative and attention to detail
strong analytical, communication and presentation skills
strong project management skills are a key asset
well-developed computer skills – excel, powerpoint
experience with sas or similar computational software an assetexperience with power bi or other bi tools such as tableau or qlik is an asset


purdue pharma is an equal opportunity employer. in accordance with the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act, 2005 and the ontario human rights code, purdue pharma will provide accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process. if selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform human resources staff of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require.

09/21/2017 application deadline 10/13/2017 database assistant job vacancy: database assistant location:  toronto reports to:  head of data and analytics duration of contract: 1 year (part-time - 21hrs/wk) closing date for applicants:  october 13, 2017 greenpeace canada is an independently funded, non-profit organization that works to protect the environment. we challenge government and industry to halt harmful practices by negotiating solutions, conducting scientific research, introducing clean alternatives, carrying out peaceful acts of civil disobedience and engaging the public. to maintain independence greenpeace does not accept donations from corporations or governments and is a non-profit organization, not a registered charity. greenpeace relies on individual donors and creative partnerships to fund our environmental campaigns and strive towards a green and peaceful future. greenpeace canada is seeking a database assistant to contribute to the efficiency and integration of greenpeace canada’s database solutions. under the direction of the head of data and analytics, the database assistant will play an important role in managing and maintaining the integrity and security of supporter information and providing the data, training, reporting, and insights needed to deliver effective fundraising and engagement campaigns. the ideal candidate will have a high level of it and excel literacy, previous experience with donor management and customer relations systems, strong analytical, problem solving, and customer service skills, and superior attention to detail when dealing with data. major responsibilities:   assist with data processing and reporting needs, including inputting, validating, manipulating, extracting and processing data according to data protocols; maintain and ensure the quality and integrity of data across fundraising and engagement platforms; ensure operational support within the data and analytics unit, assisting in updating business process workflows, quarterly reporting and annual audit preparation, etc.; provide reports and create and run queries as required; support the head of data and analytics in delivering training and support to internal users of the database; perform other tasks as assigned. required skills and experience: at least one year’s related work experience, ideally at a not-for-profit excellent organizational and time management skills in fast-paced environments excellent communications and customer service skills strong analytical and problem-solving skills superior attention to detail highly proficient in excel with experience in database management experience with raiser’s edge, engaging networks and/or cornerstone crm will be considered an asset a bachelor’s degree, fundraising diploma or equivalent combination of education and work experience you will work with colleagues in canada and around the world. candidates should understand and support greenpeace’s mission and campaign tactics, including the use of peaceful civil disobedience.  all candidates must be legally entitled to work in canada. greenpeace canada embraces equity and diversity and is committed to a workplace that is enriched by the people, needs and desires of canada’s diverse community. we thank all applicants, but only those invited for interviews will be contacted. location(s):  currently located at downsview park with plans to move to the rouge park area in 2019 reports to:  executive director compensation: tbd, commensurate with experience   about toronto wildlife centre   toronto wildlife centre (twc), a registered charity, is the only wildlife centre in the greater toronto area and the busiest in canada. approximately 5,000 wild animals are admitted to the centre each year representing over 270 different species of wildlife.  dedicated to the rehabilitation of sick, injured and orphaned wildlife, and to educating the public on wildlife-related issues, twc was the first wildlife centre in canada with a full veterinary hospital and the only one with a dedicated wildlife rescue program, and is open 365 days a year.  position summary in this unique and exciting role, you will combine your creative communication and social media skills with your passion for promoting peaceful co-existence for people and wildlife. you will join a fantastic team of staff and volunteers committed to educating the public on wildlife issues and providing medical and rehabilitative care to sick, injured and orphaned wildlife, with the goal of releasing healthy animals back into the wild. as a key member of the team, the communications assistant will assist with strategy for all communications, website, and public relations messages to consistently articulate toronto wildlife centre’s mission. your goal is to advance our position and profile with relevant constituents, as well as drive broader awareness and donor support. scope includes assisting with content creation for our varied and integrated communications channels and ensuring adherence to our style and branding guidelines. key responsibilities assist with developing and implementing an integrated strategic communications plan to broaden awareness of programs and mission, and increase the visibility of our programs across key stakeholder audiences identify fundraising challenges and emerging issues collaborate with staff to recognize communications opportunities and solutions, and execute appropriate strategies to support them compile marketing and user statistics to inform ongoing strategy assist with the development of print and web communications including social media postings, website and blog content, newsletters, brochures and donor correspondence, while maintaining brand standards and enforcing style guidelines assist with posting “to-the-moment” content on our website and social media channels and monitor our presence on social media channels assist with updating our website and review and approve content from other members of staff assist with managing volunteer photographers, videographers and graphic designers work collaboratively with communications staff and volunteers assist with developing messaging for annual fundraising assist with other communication and fundraising tasks as needed requirements excellent writing/editing and verbal communication skills strong attention to detail in both design and writing strong track record as an implementer who thrives on managing a variety of key initiatives sincere commitment to work collaboratively with all constituent groups, including staff, board members, volunteers, donors, program participants, and other supporters ability to work quickly and under tight timelines to communicate “to-the-moment” news and funding needs excellent and persuasive communicator self-starter, able to work independently, and entrepreneurial; enjoys creating and implementing new initiatives advanced computer skills — i.e.; ms word, excel, wordpress, adobe photoshop and indesign savvy with current popular social media channels ability to work efficiently and effectively within a fast paced and dynamic environment passion for toronto wildlife centre’s mission assets  education background in communications graphic design abilities experience in a communications role education and/or experience in fundraising basic photography skills basic understanding of seo and web analytics how to apply: please mention you saw this posting on workinnonprofits.ca. to apply: please e-mail cover letter, resume and references to hr@torontowildlifecentre.com[anti-spam measure - please enable javascript to view] with subject line “communications assistant.” attention shannon brown. due to high number of expected applicants, only those individuals who qualify for an interview will be contacted. no inquiries please. contact details: shannon browntoronto wildlife centre60 carl hall rd., unit 4toronto, on, m3k 2c1 tel: 416-631-0662e-mail: hr@torontowildlifecentre.com[anti-spam measure - please enable javascript to view] www:   www.torontowildlifecentre.com  thanks for looking on title: Data Analyst
text:
job description - data analyst (17013396)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|all jobsbeginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - data analyst (17013396)job description data analyst requisition id: 17013396position type: regularposition status: full timejob: compliancework location: canada-ontario-toronto-161 bay street, 39th floorunposting date: oct 18, 2017, 12:59:00 am description   
cibc is a leading canadian-based global financial institution. through our three major businesses – retail and business banking, wealth management and capital markets – we provide a full range of financial products and services to 11 million individual, small business, commercial, corporate and institutional clients in canada and around the world. we invest in our businesses, our clients, our people and our communities to deliver consistent and sustainable earnings to our shareholders.  to learn more about cibc’s lines of business, please visit our website. 
 
cibc delivers access to career and development opportunities, safe and healthy workplaces, effective training, and positive work-life balance – so that employees are able to perform at their best, contribute to their communities and focus on cultivating deeper relationships with our clients.
 
every year, cibc is recognized for its business success, community commitment and employee initiatives.  we are proud of this success and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace and an environment where all employees can excel. 
 
to learn more about cibc and the cibc group of companies please visit cibc.com.  
 
the compliance department's objective is to achieve its mandate and to help business group leaders fulfill their regulatory compliance responsibilities while, at the same time, enabling them to achieve their business goals. together with the business groups, and in line with cibc's risk appetite statement, compliance works to manage and mitigate regulatory compliance risk while building a strong, innovative and relationship-oriented bank, to protect cibc's reputation and brand, and to help cibc succeed in its mission. compliance strives to do so in a manner that is consistent with cibc's values of trust, teamwork and accountability. 
the compliance department's objective is to achieve its mandate and to help business group leaders fulfill their regulatory compliance responsibilities while, at the same time, enabling them to achieve their business goals. together with the business groups, and in line with cibc's risk appetite statement, compliance works to manage and mitigate regulatory compliance risk while building a strong, innovative and relationship-oriented bank, to protect cibc's reputation and brand, and to help cibc succeed in its mission. compliance strives to do so in a manner that is consistent with cibc's values of trust, teamwork and accountability. 
 
job overview 
 
reporting to the director of capital markets compliance, the position (compliance officer/ data analyst) will be responsible for conducting daily review of conduct via trading and sales activity and for identification of suspicious or unusual transactions or trading patterns or sales, which may suggest a breach of cibc’s information barrier procedures, policies or regulatory requirements. the incumbent will investigate, document and report such transactions and recommend appropriate courses of action to compliance management for consideration. the position will also be responsible for reviewing processes to identify and recommend improvements with a focus on data analytics and automation.
 
what you’ll be doing


develop or augment tools  to query data and work on database design with internal partners with an understanding of compliance mandate and financial products.
collaborate with other team members in creating efficiency by developing automation tools for manual processes.

analyze project and technical risk plans for possible short-term initiatives and recommend opportunities for enhancement, ensuring alignment with department’s goals and objectives.

apply a variety of analysis to interpret data and identify patterns.investigate, compile, document, and prepare information for regulatory inquiries using adp and smarts, and smarts data base, cognos, bloomberg, postedge, iress, ices, trs and emc records. 
conduct testing for compliance with designated umir, tse, ats and me requirements and cibc policies and procedures, escalating any non-compliance to compliance management. 
what we’re looking for 

must be highly proficient in the use of microsoft excel, access and sql querying with a minimum of 3 years of relevant technical expertise. must be able to write simple to complex macros in excel with strong knowledge of sql queries to automate multiple use of different programs. 
bachelor’s degree or equivalent in mathematics or computer science would be considered an asset.
knowledge of equity and equity derivatives trading practices and market structure issues gained at an investment dealer, regulator or marketplace would be considered an asset.
knowledge of fixed income, foreign exchange and/or derivatives trading practices gained at a financial institution or regulator would be considered an asset. 
detailed working knowledge of the activities of the capital markets division of a financial institution sufficient to interpret, analyze and apply relevant issues and developments in creative ways to day-to-day issues
working knowledge of compliance practices, procedures and principles to perform in-depth analysis of trading transactions, including non-routine and sensitive situations would be considered an asset
ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of a team
strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate and influence assertively, clearly and concisely, both in writing and verbally
willingness to continuously upgrade skills
ability to work with many interruptions, switch gears quickly and balance competing priorities 
what cibc can offer you 

flexible health benefits, stock purchase options, competitive incentive pay and recognition programs
competitive salary and banking benefits 
career growth, development and continuous learning opportunities
opportunity to be involved in cibc events that help our communities
click to learn more about rewards & recognition, learning & development, and employee community involvement 
what you should know

must be legally eligible to work in canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work permit or study permit that allows the candidate to fulfill the requirements of the role.

the senior manager, strategic analytics works with business, technology & operations, enterprise risk teams and data base partners to lead the design, development, and implementation of analytics solutions that drive measurable business outcomes and create a distinctive customer experience.  the senior manager, strategic analytics plays a key role in influencing the data architecture and data repository build for future analytical needs, providing thought leadership and insights from new data for strategies and  conducting research and analysis, generating ideas, structuring data and building predictive models and solutions.
 
this is an exciting opportunity that is on the forefront of a critical enterprise capability, providing thought leadership to the enterprise on the value of data and analytics.  the incumbent will get to work with and support multiple lines of business to help them achieve their objectives.
 
this role could also be quite attractive for a past data scientist who has performed big data analytics on large volumes and wide varieties of data.  the role would permit the incumbent to be engaged on both the business and technology side and will use analytics to provide additional insight to our environment and provide intelligence that will act as a catalyst of change.
 

leveraging data to drive insights and recommendation on variables that can be used to improve credit decisions 

selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using advanced modeling techniques 
data mining using state-of-the-art methods 
doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
 

building prediction models to help improve credit decisioning with objective to provide better customer experience 

creating regression based models to help improve credit decisioning 
leveraging machine learning and/or other advanced analytical techniques to improve current prediction models 
building high quality analytic solutions that are intuitive for senior audiences, simple to maintain, and drive real business outcomes
 

supporting the data infrastructure and data repository build for retail business including risk reporting and analytics 

represent the risk team for the build of data infrastructure for risk reporting and analytics. champion the process/ partner with relevant retail business stakeholders to guide the infrastructure build for retail 
extending company’s data with third party sources of information when needed 
enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems across retail business 
processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
 

manages key relationships with partners to build a lasting foundation of trust and advice 

work with partners in business, technology & operations, enterprise risk teams and data base partners
 

contributing to building an enterprise community of data & analytics practitioners to facilitate best practice sharing and support.qualifications knowledge:

university degree in business/commerce, data sciences, engineering, finance and/or mathematics (graduate level degrees preferred) and/or 7 to 10 years of experience in analytics, finance and/or consulting. 
advanced knowledge of design and analysis methodologies to work in an agile development environment. 
experience with common data science toolkits, such as r, python, etc. . excellence in at least one of these is highly desirable. 
experience with data visualisation tools, such as spotfire, tableau etc. 
proficiency in using query languages such as sql, sas
skills:

exhibits advanced analytical, critical thinking skills, and integrative skills. 
demonstrates solid communication skills (both written and verbal) and relationship management skills at a senior management level. 
demonstrates ability to build a good fact base, apply sound reasoning, and generate relevant recommendations that get implemented and lead to business success. 
demonstrates innovative thinking and creativity. 
is able to handle multiple priorities. 
is able to work highly independently and work successfully with a team that has diverse skills, knowledge, and educational backgrounds.

we’re here to help
 
at bmo we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our dna. for 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. we help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.
 
as a member of the bmo team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. we strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. we’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. from in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
 
to find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com.

section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - data scientist – customer insights (pla03239-17)job description data scientist – customer insights - pla03239-17description position overview:   the performance analysis consultant is an expert/advisory level position. as performance analysis consultant – customer 360 insights within the journey design & delivery team, this candidate will be reporting to manager, c360 insights. the candidate will be responsible for providing actionable customer insights to resolve strategic and tactical marketing issues by building advanced statistical models using sas, sql and other data mining tools. the role would be expected to provide thought-leadership in researching new modeling techniques/solutions to solve complex marketing issues. along with the manager, c360 insights, the candidate will co-lead the integration of customer insights into telus’ omni channel marketing strategy to enable better decisions that drive revenue/ebitda growth, manage churn and reduce customer effort across various lines of business.   responsibilities:  strategies and planning:  assist the manager, c360 insights to cultivate a fact-based-data-driven decision making culture inside and outside the marketing department and implement the best-in-class end-to-end modeling process to gain operational efficiency assist the manager, c360 insight to identify business issues through analytics; provide actionable insights and influence business partners to take action based on analytical/modeling insights   thought leadership and teamwork:  contribute to the ongoing development of the team by sharing information, success, lessons learned of own project work collaboratively with marketing primes to develop modelling requirements and prioritization; present model results and actionable recommendations to internal business clients and senior leadership mentors junior team members from a technical as well as business acumen perspective assist the manager, c360 insights to drive for the cultivation of a hybrid culture (analytics and business) to share insights/learnings to demonstrate value of big data analytics and investments to business partner teams (data - insights - strategy - results)   day-to-day portfolio/deliverable management:  contribute to the development of the omni channel strategy by developing near real-time predictive models and trigger based strategies leveraging sas/sas enterprise miner, hive, spark, python, r, etc work collaboratively with business partners teams to understand, compartmentalize complex and ambiguous business issues into crisp and manageable pieces develop analytical blueprint to solve compartmentalized business issues and assembly to the big picture solution present customer insights to cross functional business partners including marketing, channel, products & services, customer experience and digital own the end-to-end development of campaign targeting through analytics and building propensity models/response models using various multivariate modelling/data mining techniques   expert knowledge:  be recognized as the top expert in predictive modeling, data mining, r&d within telus educate, advocate and advise cross-functional business partners at team member level in advanced analytics and predictive modeling maintain a solid and updated knowledge in the predictive modeling, data mining field including applications of big data, text analytics, social network analytics, cross channel modelling   qualifications required knowledge:  business orientation:  advanced business acumen, relationship management and influencing without authority skills; ability to provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis strong ability to prioritize tasks from multiple stakeholders and meet deadlines with quality deliverables advanced written, oral, communications, presentation skills and knowledge of microsoft office suite   technical expertise:  advanced knowledge in various advanced predictive modeling/data mining techniques to ensure effective solutions to marketing issues extensive hands-on experience in sas (or sas enterprise guide), sas enterprise miner, hive, spark, r, python, sql and other data query language on unix/pc and comfortable working with very large data sets and databases strong quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills    required skills & abilities:  change management: self-driven individual with ability to adapt to varying business environments and effectively drive business results by leveraging analytics mentorship: strong leadership, coaching, mentoring skills  required professional designation/certification:  phd in statistics, economics, mathematics, computer science or other quantitative field is preferred master’s degree with extensive relevant experience and knowledge will be strongly considered  required experience:  10+ years of related predictive modeling experience, preferably in marketing telecom/industry experience would be beneficial credit risk modeling experience will be considered  who is telus?    we're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make telus one of the leading telecommunications companies in canada. our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and optik tv™. we also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.   everyone belongs at telus. it doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at telus, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.   do you share our passion?       at telus, you create future friendly® possibilities.   at telus, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. primary location: ca-on-torontoschedule: full-timeaccessibilitytelus is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. we are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

title: Data Scientist
text:
407 etr | career



skip to content






























search





































career opportunities







data scientist


location:
headquarters


job code:
504


# of openings:
2



description
position summary:
the successful candidate will assist in leveraging customer, digital and transportation datasets to create insights on pricing, marketing and customer behavior. the data scientist will assist the director of data analytics and other key stakeholders to bring actionable data driven solutions to 407etr. this job involves model design, data management, data queries, and providing input into programs and policies. this position is part of a highly collaborative and energetic team in a start-up minded environment.
position responsibility:

assemble and analyze data to understand customer behavior from existing 407 etr data, external data sources and emerging sources.


undertake analysis of target customer groups (segments) for specific marketing and pricing programs and assess opportunities and strategies for marketing.
ad hoc analysis and modeling of data.
ability to understand business stakeholder’s issues and create valuable insight.
raise awareness and action of data science within the company to help focus on fact based decisions.
support the department along with the information technology management department in planning the structure and storage of new customer related data fields.
represent the department in committees within the organization.

qualifications:

a university degree in engineering, statistics, mathematics, or computer science.


minimum 5 years working experience with data science techniques: clustering, regression models, classification, anomaly detection and other machine learning techniques.
minimum 5 years of experience with data analysis tools (eg. sas, r or python) and bi visualization for reporting.
well-developed business analysis, research and creative problem solving skills.
organizational skills and time management skills; planning and project management, and ability to meet multiple deadlines.
strong communication skills and work ethic.
highly collaborative team player with an entrepreneurial spirit.
familiarity with microstrategy is an asset.

note: this job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.
accommodations for disabilities or other grounds protected by human rights legislation are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the employment selection process.

data scientist, data & analytics






toronto, on 


job description


working at kpmg allows you to gain valuable on-the-job experience while building your professional network and business acumen. being part of the kpmg global member firm of 155 countries and 174,000 professionals, you’ll be part of a high performing team and have access to ongoing professional development and mentorship at every level. you will work with national and global organizations, adding value and gaining valuable on-the-job experience. at kpmg, we’ll provide you with the support to drive your own career and discover the countless opportunities available. position summary our data and analytics practice is a strategic growth initiative for kpmg and it is growing rapidly. we provide clients with d&a solutions which range from the foundational to very advanced. we often help clients with first-of-a-kind capabilities which helps them transform and become leaders in their space. our innovation driven growth provides practitioners lots of opportunity to learn and develop. d&a practitioners are expected to be proficient on several of the following capabilities and are expected to work on engagements, which will include one or more of the following: help our clients transform in a digital world: business and analytics strategy to adapt to changes resulting from technological advances, disruption of business models and data monetizationartificial intelligence and automation: develop intelligent bots to help eliminate bias, human error, and inefficiency in decision making.virtual and augmented reality and the internet of things: understand and articulate how technologies such as these are changing the world. prototype and develop solutions which include vr/ar and iot which change user experience, business models and much moreanalytical enterprise: enabling people with tools, process and governanceinformation management: building trust in the data they use and report, as well as how it is managed and storeddata engineering and big data: ensuring architecture is scalable and flexible to business changereporting & visualization: identifying the right kpis, dashboard to help effectively monitor performance and enable insight discoveryadvanced analytics: enabling greater insight into business drivers and future outlook to proactively inform business decisions using supervised and unsupervised techniques read here to know more about: kpmg data & analytics role & responsibilitieswork closely with clients in understanding key business issues. gather and analyze requirements to develop impactful recommendations and solutionsutilize advanced analytical techniques to solve challenging business problems. propose and develop results, models and rules engines using statistical, machine learning, natural language processing, linear programming, etc.work with large volumes of data (structured and unstructured). investigate and perform deeper analysis to produce impactful algorithms to achieve targeted outcomesperform quantitative analysis of data issuescome to work with an intrinsic desire to change your worldinspire a very smart and talented team to be better at what they already do and innovate in new areaslead engagements and teams to successful outcomes with a focus on problem solving and executionunderstand the business challenge, the data points associated with that scenario and be able to formulate solutions through the application of people, process, technology and databe a thought leader in your area of expertise skills & qualifications:an insatiable curiosity to learn, an aptitude to figure it out and a hunger to make a differencestrong communication and interpersonal skillsability to think critically and laterally – problem solve and innovate within a team environment high level of attention to detail, excellent time management skills, ability to perform under pressurepost-secondary education equivalent to a university degree in numerate or analytical disciplines such as mathematics, computer science, or engineering. (candidates with the equivalent of a master’s degree in a relevant subject including, but not limited to mathematics, science, engineering, business administration, marketing, operational research, economics, statistics , ai, computer science or a related field etc. will be preferred.) technical skills:a successful track record of leading large scale data driven engagements within integrated, multi-disciplinary project teamsproven data extraction, analysis, cleansing, quality and manipulation skills, as well as experience handling very large volumes of datawell versed with the software development lifecycle, product management, principles of software engineering or data mining methodologiesextensive experience with standard statistical packages or languages (r, python, matlab, sas, spss, etc.)proficiency in scripting (perl, powershell, etc.) experience with programming languages such as (python, java, c, c++, etc.)prior exposure to tools like alteryx, tableau, spotfire, powerbi, etc.experience with hadoop (hdfs, hive, pig, informatica, erwin, etc.), databases (sql server, oracle, etc.), solution definition and application, and  methods (sdlc, pmlc)experience with embedded os for iot is a plusexperience with microsoft hololens is a plusproficient in microsoft powerpoint, excel, access and wordhaving fun is key to our productivity and creativity and we provide access to cool relaxation gadgets. we enjoy our work and work hard with a relentless focus on quality and success. at times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this. #li-143683426_ak1

our values, the kpmg way

we lead by example | we work together | we respect the individual  we seek the facts and provide insight | we are open and honest in our communication  we are committed to our communities | above all, we act with integritykpmg is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. kpmg encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. if you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the hr shared service centre by email at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or by phone at 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 (option 1). kpmg will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

title: 
                        
senior manager, digital data & reporting- toronto,on
                        









 

requisition id: 3914
join the global community of scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
 
purpose of job
the senior manager, data & reporting analyst is responsible for creating reports and analytics results that track performance in key areas such as digital customer adoption, usage and sales. this role acts as the digital data sme in performing technical data analysis, producing monthly reports and being the group’s data representative. through data etl and working closely with various data teams and enterprise data warehouse / data lake, this role updates key digital data in databases and maintains data integrity. outside of regular data/reporting deliverables, this role also provides trending analysis, data-backed insight, as well as supports campaign measurement and new functionality development support towards the bank’s digital transformation objectives.

major accountabilities
 

works with various data teams, enterprise data warehouse and data lake to ensure month-end data production runs in orderly fashion, and address/resolve data anomalies
performs data pulls from various sources (sql and non sql) and maintain data integrity through data validation and auditing
tracks customer adoption, usage and sales for multiple digital channels (scotiaonline, mobile apps, mobile web) and identifies underlying trends and behaviours
independently creates various reports and dashboards for the needs of broad audience, includes executives, enterprise strategy, digital organization, operation teams, etc.
updates existing mis data systems with digital data
prepares ad-hoc reports and analysis based on needs
explores and accesses new data from various platforms, and ensure proper incorporation of any new data feeds
interprets analytics results and presents findings to upper management team
performs measurement of digital marketing campaigns, new product development and new customer experience functionalities
participates in future development and improvement of mis systems that might involve sas/sql, as400, hadoop/hive and other data and reporting systems
identifies and deliver new means of enhancing business intelligence and analytics


education/work experience

bachelor degree in computer science, mathematics, digital marketing, business, or related fields
5-7 years of proven track record in data analytics or technical disciplines in financial or telecommunication industry
python, spark, r with skills in sas and sql coding skills
extended experience in analyzing customer, transaction and sales data
in-depth understanding of digital delivery channels (mobile, online, abm, etc.)
experience in analytical/statistics tools (eg. excel, alteryx, r)
experience in graphing/visualization tools (eg. powerpoint, tableau)
exposure in data management platforms (eg. db2, hadoop, cloud solutions)
passionate about data, digital innovations and cutting-edge technology
excellent communication (written and verbal) and presentation skill

 
location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. we are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.









job segment: 
database, telecom, telecommunications, bank, banking, technology, finance

title: HR Analytics & Compensation Specialist
text:
career center






























new search
                       
                    


login page
                       
                    














position description











 



hr analytics & compensation specialist




location


toronto




job code


87




# of openings


1




apply now
cmls financial, one of canada’s largest mortgage lenders and technology innovators, is currently seeking a professional, energetic, and tech-savvy hr analytics & compensation specialist in either our vancouver or toronto office to provide expertise on a variety of hr programs and services, specifically concentrating on compensation, benefits and reporting.  reporting to the senior director, human resources and working closely with the hr and management teams, you will act in an advisory capacity for compensation review, analysis of market trends, managing of the semi-monthly payroll and benefits program and provide various reporting to multiple stakeholders. the hr analytics & compensation specialist will be results-oriented, accurate with a strong attention to detail and demonstrates a high degree of accountability.  it is expected that you will work with the hr team on a variety of activities, including the following: recruitment, orientation, performance management, employee relations and employee communications. 
 
our successful candidate will possess superior communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to manage their time effectively while completing high-quality work in a fast-paced environment. this is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced hr professional to truly become a strategic business partner and have a tremendous impact. you will find success based on your abilities in the following areas:
50% of your time will be spent on managing compensation programs, the payroll and benefits function and reporting. working with our leaders and the hr team:


you will manage compensation, including working closely with the managed payroll provider and act as the owner of the semi-monthly salary processing, as well as employee and government inquiries.  working directly with the senior director on compensation plan design and pay-bands based on market compensation trends.


you will own the benefits function, including working closely with our benefits consultants and act as the owner of the benefit plan processing (enrollments, employee changes, and monthly reconciliations).  you will handle inquiries about benefits and acts as the hr team liaison for matters involving the finance team and the benefits consultants. 


you will complete all document management and reporting requirements for various stakeholders, including maintaining accurate, up-to-date, and complete employee records and hr information and related record systems in compliance with applicable legislation. you will complete scheduled and ad-hoc reporting and analysis related to employee data and compensation.


 
25% of your time will be spent on supporting individuals, managers and the hr team by:


supporting hr projects and other functional areas as required in accordance to the hr cycle including but not limited to establishing pay bands, supporting the teams with salary reviews, compliance and industry best practices; recommend changes and modifications to existing policies and programs to remain in compliance and adopt best practices where applicable.


becoming an innovator with great ideas for our team(s): as an hr team, work on a variety of special projects and initiatives that drive excellent people management practices, awesome company culture and mitigate risk and foster open communication.


 
25% of your time will be spent supporting the hr team: 


support process review to identify gaps, enhancements, and efficiencies for the hr team 


support hr technology implementations and modifications to drive workflows, automation, and audit controls


during hr technology implementations, the allocation to the work assignment could be as high as 50% of your time. 


 
this role is for you if:


you completed a university degree in business administration, industrial relations, commerce or psychology, with a professional designation (such as cphr considered an asset). payroll certification is an asset. 


you have a minimum of 3-5 years of experience as an hr generalist in various functions with specialization in compensation and benefits. experience in managing the processing of salaries, bonuses, commissions, and other forms of compensation.


you possess advanced technical skills using microsoft applications including office, excel, visio, sharepoint, and powerpivot which will be essential for success.


you have advanced knowledge of payroll systems, internal controls, and management including advising, recommending and implementing new hris systems.


you have experience managing projects with excellent knowledge of organization design, human resource practices and performance measurements practices.


you are exceptionally client focus and service orientated, with demonstrated leadership and the ability to establish and maintain relationships with both management and staff.


you have proven ability in collaborating and partnering with the business.


you are flexible and interested in working for a growing and fast-paced organization.


who are we?
we are canada’s mortgage company. founded in 1974, cmls financial is one of canada’s largest, independently owned mortgage services companies. we currently originate over $2.5 billion of commercial mortgages each year and since 2013, have helped over 10,000 canadians achieve their dream of homeownership.
learn more at www.cmls.ca or check out our careers page on linkedin.
 
you will love working here:
employees tell us that they love that we strike the balance in creating an incredibly professional, yet dynamic and enjoyable corporate culture. we work in a fluid and fast-paced environment that is supportive of energetic and motivated individuals who pride themselves on being flexible and results-driven. our employees get valuable industry knowledge and experience and have the opportunity to an impactful career with cmls. we are committed to providing our people with a challenging and rewarding career because our employees are what set us apart and we know it.

business intelligence and analytics manager
 
at j.d. irving, limited, you are part of an energetic team of professionals who lead with integrity and are passionate about achieving results.  with a culture that nurtures talent and creates an inclusive workplace, you can grow your career across our diverse operating divisions.
summary of ideal candidate:

self-starter with ability to design, develop and implement a wide range of cognos solutions
work independently or as part of a team
excellent written and verbal communication skills
strong customer focus and delivery
highest education level / certifications required:

bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathmatics, operations management or a related field
minimum 5 years experience in a directly related area
extensive expertise in key toolsets (cognos, tableau, ersi gis) with a solid understanding of key bi trends
strong database understanding
experience managing large complex bi projects and teams
a solid understanding of mobile delivery architecture and best practices
responsibilities:

strategy development, building the execution plan and managing the day-to-day operations of the bi team
responsible for all operational, financial, technical and resource management responsibilities associated with:

master data management
what are they day to day responsibilities?
reporting, analytics, data exploration
bi compentency center
data preparation (sourcing, acqusision, integration)
bi governance
information delivery (portals, mobile)
advance/predictive analytics
 
to apply for this career opportunity:
 
please apply online by october 31st, 2017.
 
we appreciate your interest in our company!  the initial review of applications will happen on an on-going basis. applications received after the deadline may not be considered.  only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  
 
to learn more about our products and services, click here.

reference number: tbd17j-014677-003246selection process number: 2017-tbd-ea-ba-102962-01



	treasury board of canada secretariat
	
 	- expenditure management sector
	

























ottawa (ontario)














ec-03, ec-04





	
	




  indeterminate and determinate





	
	ec-03 salary: $63,428 to $71,769 and ec-04 salary: $68,468 to $79,234



	for further information on the organization, please visit treasury board of canada secretariat
closing date:


	
	10 october 2017 - 23:59, pacific time
	

who can apply:




 
 
persons residing in canada and canadian citizens residing abroad. 
 
 





















apply online


important messages
note that this advertisement was originally posted as selection process number: 2017-tbd-ea-ba-102962.only applications received directly via the system (https://www.canada.ca/en/public-service-commission/jobs/services/public-service-jobs.html) will be accepted. if you require accommodation for any reason, you must contact the hr advisor listed below before the closing date. if you do not clearly demonstrate how you meet all screening criteria, your application will be rejected. your application may also be rejected if it has incomplete information. we will not contact you to request information that is missing from your application
work environmentare you a data-driven problem solver with a solid foundation in math or computer science? are you intellectually curious, self-motivated, and possess strong business acumen? the treasury board of canada secretariat is looking for motivated data scientists to join a multidisciplinary team dedicated to improving transparency and openness in government reporting through the tbs infobase—a searchable online database providing financial and human resources information on government of canada operations.the successful candidate will, among other things, work to create data visualizations and new data systems, integrate existing data systems to create intelligence, use new technologies to extract more value from existing data and automate analysis which is currently done manually.the treasury board of canada secretariat (tbs) is a central agency located in the national capital region. working at tbs offers a unique opportunity to contribute to the work of a central federal agency, and to be part of cultivating the federal public service as a model workplace. with high-performing teams and innovative practices, tbs professionals in various fields serve canadians by collaborating on government-wide initiatives, driving excellence in people management and taking initiative while effectively managing risks.if you are a leader, a motivator and a strategic thinker who wants to work for one of canada’s top employers, consider joining the tbs team.
intent of the process

		anticipatory process - a pool of qualified persons resulting from this process will be created and may be used to fill similar positions with linguistic profiles (english essential, french essential, bilingual imperative bbb/bbb, bilingual imperative cbc/cbc, bilingual non-imperative bbb/bbb, bilingual non-imperative cbc/cbc) as well as tenures (indeterminate, deployment, acting, assignment, secondment, specified period) which may vary according to the position being staffed.this pool will be used to staff similar positions in other organizations within the core public administration (http://www.psc-cfp.gc.ca/plcy-pltq/rfli-lirf/index-eng.htm).by applying to this process, you consent to your personal application-related information being shared with other government departments interested in staffing similar positions.



positions to be filled:





number to be determined







information you must provide

  
  
    your résumé.
  

  
  

  
  

  
  
  
  

  
  

  
  

  you must meet all essential qualifications in order to be appointed to the position. other qualifications may be a deciding factor in choosing the person to be appointed. some essential and other qualifications will be assessed through your application. it is your responsibility to provide appropriate examples that illustrate how you meet each qualification. failing to do so could result in your application being rejected.

in order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)education:graduation with a degree from a recognized post-secondary institution with acceptable specialization in economics, sociology or statistics.candidates must always have a degree. the courses* for the specialization must be acceptable and may have been taken at a recognized post-secondary institution, but not necessarily within a degree program in the required specialization. the specialization may also be obtained through an acceptable combination of education, training and/or experience.*note that the course requirement can be attained in programs such as: mathematics, computer science, data science/data analytics, accounting, demography/population studies, environmental sciences, epidemiology, geology, and/or finance.degree equivalencyexperience common to both streams:-experience in large scale* data management, validation, cleaning and categorizing as well as database development, data mining and data analysis, including recent** experience with tools such as python, r, sas, or sql.*large scale is based on data records numbering in the thousands or above.**recent is defined as experience normally acquired within the last three (3) years.the following will be applied / assessed at a later date (essential for the job)various language requirements-bilingual imperative bbb/bbb and cbc/cbc;-bilingual non-imperative bbb/bbb and cbc/cbc;-english essential;-french essential.information on language requirementsec-03 stream:experience in any one (1) of the following: -recent** experience using programming languages (such as python, r, javascript, ruby or sas) to develop data visualizations;-experience undertaking research and analysis to produce reports summarizing empirical findings;-experience in using machine learning methodologies to solve problems.ec-04 stream:-recent** experience in using programming languages (python, r, javascript, ruby, or sas) to develop data visualizations;-experience in undertaking research and analysis to produce reports summarizing empirical findings;-experience in using machine learning methodologies to solve problems. **recent is defined as experience normally acquired within the last three (3) years.knowledge:-knowledge of programming languages (such as python, r, javascript, ruby, sas, or sql) and techniques used to analyze and present complex data to non-technical audiences.abilities:-ability to analyze and present complex data to non-technical audiences using programming languages and related techniques;-ability to build and maintain professional relationships;-ability to communicate effectively in writing;-ability to communicate effectively orally.personal suitability:-creative thinking;-reliability; -flexibility;-initiative.the following may be applied / assessed at a later date (may be needed for the job)asset qualificationseducation:one or more of the following:(1) a graduate or post-graduate degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial mathematics, data science, computer science, applied finance, or engineering.(2) university-level courses in any of the following: -data mining;-data warehousing;-business intelligence and data visualizations; -data analytics;-geo-spatial analysis. (3) certifications relevant to the field including:-chartered public accountant (cpa);-chartered financial analyst (cfa);-certified analytics professional (cap);-cloudera certified professional: data scientist (ccp:ds);-emc: data science associate (emcdsa).degree equivalencyexperience:-recent* experience working with the wet (web experience toolkit) and wcag 2.0 guidelines for accessibility;-experience in policy development or program delivery in an area that spans the government of canada’s responsibilities (e.g. infrastructure, it infrastructure, procurement, indigenous peoples, veterans, students, etc.);-experience working with government of canada expenditure management or people management data;-experience working with unstructured data such as text, social media, video feeds or audio;-recent* experience working in a collaborative developer/information technology (it) professional environment to automate the process of software delivery and infrastructure changes (for example dev ops);-experience working with big data including use of technologies such as distributed calculation, distributed databases, and hadoop;-experience in developing and supporting the implementation of business rules, standards, policies, guidelines or processes related to one or more of the following: data access, creation, production, storage, dissemination or evaluation of data/metadata;-working with and structuring large scale** geo-coded data for analysis and presentation;-experience working with any of the following: spss, java, perl, c/c++, hadoop, d3, shiny, tableau, and/or powerbi.*recent is defined as experience normally acquired within the last three (3) years.**large scale is based on data records numbering in the thousands or above.organizational needs:-treasury board secretariat employees affected by workforce adjustment may be appointed before persons employed by other government organizations.-in support of achieving a diverse workforce, consideration may be given to candidates self-identifying as belonging to one of the following employment equity groups: aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and women.operational requirements: -willingness to work overtime on short notice;-willingness to travel occasionally.conditions of employmentvarious security levels: -reliability status security clearance;-secret security clearance.
other information
we will communicate with you about this process by email. as a result, you must update your public service resourcing system profile if it changes. applicants should use an email address that accepts messages from unknown senders (some email systems block such messages).if you do not respond to our communications, we will interpret this as your withdrawal from the process.candidates may be required to meet the asset qualifications or the organizational needs, depending on the requirements of the specific position being staffed.reference checks will be sought.an interview will be administered.a test will be administered.please identify clearly for which position(s) you are submitting an application.you must provide proof of your education credentials.persons are entitled to participate in the appointment process in the official language of their choice.you must indicate on your application if you require a technical aid for testing or an alternative method of assessment.
the public service of canada is committed to building a skilled, diverse workforce reflective of canadian society. as a result, it promotes employment equity and encourages candidates to indicate voluntarily on their application if they are a woman, an aboriginal person, a person with a disability or a member of a visible minority group.
the public service of canada is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. if contacted in relation to a job opportunity or testing, you should advise the public service commission or the departmental official in a timely fashion of the accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.
preference
preference will be given to veterans and to canadian citizens, in that order.

title: Associate Manager, Business Analytics and Insights
text:
associate manager, business analytics and insights | careers @ purdue pharma canada

careers
