title: SQL Data Analyst
text:
tripelephant - sql data analyst
 
sql data analysttoronto, on|full time|developmentshare job posting:apply nowabout us:
tripelephant is a data and analytics tech startup in toronto - we act as a data driven marketing agency to large scale travel clients, and help users plan travel on www.mobytrip.com, our consumer brand. our proprietary advertising technology is the core of our business, and helps us manage and optimize large advertising budgets for our brands and our clients. we are a small team, with two technical co-founders.
about the job:
we are looking for a sql professional and analytics professional to continue building a world class understanding of marketing data. you will be dealing directly with raw data, creating queries to analyze user behaviour and find areas of growth and efficiency. you will work directly with every member of the team, as well as clients in optimizing the performance of our platform through statistical analysis.
what you'll do:

use sql (postgresql) to analyze data trends related to travel behaviours
convert ambiguous business requirements into analysis of large datasets
explore and analyze data sets fo provide insight into kpis
prepare tableau dashboards
analyze, propose/suggest areas of improvement and growth

experience:

3+ years experience in a sql dba/developer/analyst role
familiarity with postgresql
proficiency in sql, in particular familiarity with sql with and with recursive statements, table inheritance and partitioning
plpgsql experience a plus
knowledge of python would be an asset
tablaeau experience a plus
comfortable with ambiguity and working in a startup environment
detailed oriented self starter with the ability to work with minimal supervision

						welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job basket|sign inbmocareers.support@bmo.comthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy job pagebasic search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - senior manager, data scientist and machine learning specialist (1700009144)job description senior manager, data scientist and machine learning specialist-1700009144description the senior manager, data scientist and machine learning specialist, works with business and technology partners to lead the design, development, and implementation of statistical and machine learning-based solutions that drive measurable business outcomes and create a distinctive customer experience.  in this role, you will engage senior business partners to dissect business problems, conduct research and analysis, generate ideas, structure data and building end-to-end statistical and machine-learning solutions.
 
this is an exciting opportunity that is on the forefront of a critical enterprise capability and priority for the bank. as a change agent, you will be providing thought leadership to the enterprise on the value of data, analytics and machine learning and get to work with lines of business across the bank to help them achieve their objectives.
 
this role would be attractive for data scientists who have experience with big data analytics on large volumes and wide varieties of structured and unstructured data, and are looking to gain a wide exposure to problems in the financial industry.
 
what will you do?


engage business partners to advocate the benefit of machine learning, and work collaboratively to define machine learning solutions for priority business problems

lead partner interviews, brainstorming sessions and workshops to capture business objectives and prioritize opportunities


translate business objectives into high quality analytical and machine learning-based end-to-end solutions that are innovative and drive real business outcomes

lead in the design, development, and implementation of innovative machine learning and analytical solutions and build roadmaps for business transformation


design and build proofs of concept and real world statistical and machine learning solutions aligned to business priorities

generate a roadmap of opportunities with the businesses you work with and implement solutions iteratively to drive value

contribute to enterprise data and analytics strategy and champion adoption of enterprise analytics capabilities, including “big data” platforms and open source toolsqualifications what do you need to succeed?   knowledge   possesses a university degree in data science, computer science, engineering, physics, financial modeling and/or mathematics (masters or phd preferred) and/or 7 to 10 years of experience in advanced analytics with machine learning, finance and/or consulting  advanced machine learning applications of python or r, including relevant packages and statistical testing methodologies  experience with implementation of solutions with modern machine learning platforms within a hadoop environment, e.g. spark, tensorflow, and h2o  experience using a wide range of analytical techniques: supervised learning, clustering, natural language processing (nlp), recommender engines, time series analysis, a/b testing, network/link analysis, sentiment analysis and data visualization   skills   demonstrates solid communication skills (both written and verbal) and relationship management skills at a senior management level  exhibits advanced critical thinking skills, integrative skills and creativity to drive innovation   demonstrates ability to build a good fact base, apply sound reasoning, and generate relevant recommendations that get implemented and lead to business success  able to work highly independently and manage multiple priorities  possesses solid leadership skills and is able to work successfully with a team that has diverse skills, knowledge, and educational backgrounds   we’re here to help    at bmo we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our dna. for 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. we help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.    as a member of the bmo team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. we strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. we’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. from in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.    to find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com.     bmo is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. by learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.   #li-mf1              job risk managementprimary location canada-ontario-torontoorganisation data governance & analytics-x004874schedule full-timejob posting 06/13/17unposting date ongoingplease note, if you are using internet explorer this site requires ie11 or greater.

title: Energy Data Scientist
text: energy data scientist job - energy profiles limited - toronto, on | indeed.ca skip to job description, searchclose find jobsfind resumesemployers / post job upload your resume sign in : what where advanced job search       job title, keywords or company city or province energy data scientist energy profiles limited - toronto, on about eplat epl, we quantify changes to the use of our earth’s resources, so we can help our clients make better decisions for our world.we help our clients improve both their environmental performance and their bottom line while at the same time providing independent, impartial strategic guidance. our clients include some of the largest public and private companies in canada, collectively representing approximately 2.5% of national electricity use.at epl, we combine cloud-based software/analytics with a deep understanding of how buildings use energy to help our clients drive energy savings and reduce their greenhouse gas (ghg) emissions.at the same time, we help our clients manage the complexities of all types of data from utility bills, energy meters, building automation systems, and weather stations (to name a few). we leverage this data to provide trusted and insightful analytics, reporting, forecasting, and planning guidance with respect to both environmental impacts and costs.we develop energy management software. but we know that software doesn’t save energy; software built and continuously improved by smart, motivated people helps our clients – also smart, motivated people - to make good decisions.about the roleenergy data scientists are an integral part of our data systems group. this is our team of engineers, analysts, and developers who both develop and utilize our proprietary software and systems to analyze and report on utility data. as a member of the team you will:apply your expertise to a range of client projects and create meaningful outcomes.create models to analyze how energy consumption at buildings corresponds to weather.load and validate utility data – making it trusted - from various digital sources.prepare monthly and annual energy consumption and cost forecasts based on historical usage and projected utility rates and weather.prepare ghg emissions reports for our clients using recognized industry protocols.analyze, identify and quantify changes to energy consumption at properties.about youyou are smart and act with purpose. you want to be a part of building our team and company.nominally, you have an undergraduate degree in engineering, computer science, or another technical field (or equivalent experience).microsoft sql experience is considered an asset. (hint: can you write a join statement?)you demonstrate advanced proficiency in microsoft excel. (hint: can you do an index and match ?)what to expectpeople are the most important part of our company.we have found that exposure to different parts our business, systems, and processes is essential in developing our team members’ capabilities and careers. the success of our people drives the success of our company.to that end, energy data scientists typically complete several rotations in their first year at epl. each rotation involves doing real work on a different aspect of our business. potential rotations include:building analytics: how is energy used in buildings? where are the opportunities for savings?data science: what are the 5,000 pieces of energy data generated by a skyscraper every day? is the data accurate? what does it tell us?web development: how do we best present information to our clients to drive savings?data integrity: do you know what each line item on your electricity bill means? how do you know if you were billed correctly?forecasting and reporting: what insights do our clients need to help run their businesses?each team member’s specific role evolves based on their interests, aptitude, and business needs throughout their rotations.epl team members also:take unlimited vacationenjoy flexible work hours (our office has time zones!)work with a dynamic team of like-minded people and clientsparticipate in sponsored social events throughout the yearjob type: full-timejob location:toronto, onrequired education:bachelor'srequired language:english 30+ days ago - save job » apply now please review all application instructions before applying to energy profiles limited. apply now other jobs you may like data scientist moneykey - toronto, on 3 hours ago data scientist michael page international - toronto, on 4 hours ago data scientist moneykey - toronto, on 1 day ago easily apply data scientist jla recruiting - toronto, on 9 days ago easily apply senior data scientist michael page international - toronto, on 4 hours ago »see more recommended jobs - 69 new followget job updates from energy profiles limited. by selecting follow, you agree to get updated information and new jobs for this company by email. you can cancel alerts at anytime. energy profiles limited energy profiles limited (epl) is a full service energy software services and engineering firm focused on driving down energy and water use... about - help centre ©2017 indeed - cookies, privacy and terms

m&a analytics senior associate, transaction services






toronto, on 


job description


kpmg llp is the canadian member firm of kpmg and has offices in 33 locations across canada. the firm's more than 700 partners and 5,600 employees provide crucial services to many of the public and private business, not-for profit, and public-sector organizations in canada.in every economic environment, there are opportunities to create, enhance, and preserve value. our deal advisory professionals help buyers, sellers, private equity investors, governments, and lenders in developing and executing on their value strategies.by their nature, major transactions such as m&a deals are higher risk and reward than day-to-day business activity. it is important for our clients to remove as much risk as possible by taking advice from experienced advisers — people who have done it before and know what to look for.we offer start-to-finish support in the acquisition process, including input on strategy, early identification of risk areas, coordination and execution of due diligence investigations (financial and commercial) and input and advice on contract terms geared to reduce risks. we also get involved in assisting our clients with a host of services surrounding closing the transaction and post-deal integration.our deal advisory team includes the following service lines: transaction services, valuations, corporate finance, restructuring & turnaround, and infrastructure advisory.our clients are typically private equity funds, pension funds, large public companies, as well as private corporations. our people are motivated self-starters with expertise in finance, valuation, tax, accounting and financial reporting. our network is global.  position summary kpmg's transaction services is currently looking for professionals in our downtown toronto office at the senior associate level with a focus on applying proprietary and third-party data analytics solutions in a deal environment. working in multi-disciplinary teams, you will apply your professional and technical skills on a wide variety of transactions and at different stages of the transaction process.   role and responsibilities the successful candidate will be responsible for:  using kpmg proprietary and third-party data analytics tools to deliver deeper insights to our clients at deal speedworking with deal teams to evaluate a business’ historical performance and sustainability of earnings/cash flows and financial projections.identifying and reporting key issues, performing the relevant financial analysis, and interpreting results.developing analytical procedures and templates that can be deployed to others to increase the capabilities of the wider team.working with large volumes of data (structured and unstructured) - investigate and perform deeper analysis to produce impactful insights to achieve targeted outcomesconducting training and information sessions with kpmg practitioners from across the firm.participating in kpmg’s engagement teams with senior client executives, attorneys, and investors.writing detailed professional reports and other client deliverables.establishing credibility and developing relationships with current and prospective clients.providing support/assistance for proposals.contributing to the effective working of the team and development of team morale.occasionally supporting one of our other business units in a cross-functional role (e.g. valuations, corporate finance, restructuring, global infrastructure project group, etc.). at times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this. skills & qualifications a successful candidate will possess the following skills and behaviours:highly motivated, committed, and flexible to cope with changing priorities and strict deadlines.financial and commercial awareness with strong analytical skills.demonstrated ability to learn and succeed in a fast-paced environment is essential.curiosity, healthy skepticism, creativity, and attention to detail.the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.excellent verbal and written communication skills.ability to build effective working relationships internally and externally.willingness and ability to travel internationally as required. technical skills: post-secondary education equivalent to a university degree in business or numerate or analytical disciplines such as mathematics, statistics, computer science.experience with databases (sql server) data extraction, analysis, cleansing, quality and manipulation skills, as well as experience handling very large volumes of data.prior exposure to tools like alteryx, tableau, qlikexperience with standard statistical packages or languages (r, python, matlab, sas, spss, etc.) is an assetproficient in microsoft powerpoint, excel, access and word#li-gr1 

our values, the kpmg way

we lead by example | we work together | we respect the individual we seek the facts and provide insight | we are open and honest in our communication we are committed to our communities | above all, we act with integritykpmg is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. kpmg encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. if you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the hr shared service centre by email at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or by phone at 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 (option 1). kpmg will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

date posted: 
sep 21, 2017
                                

 reference code: 28626-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: toronto, ontario, canada 
all available locations: kitchener; montreal; ottawa; toronto; vancouver 
external posting descriptionwe are looking for a technical lead for digital marketing, in our oracle marketing cloud team.
the senior consultant at deloitte works within an engagement team and is responsible for driving to a plan and with a team. the role requires liaising with the senior leadership (client and deloitte), and implementing core martech technologies for clients. in this role you will be responsible for working on consultative engagements to develops, implement, and optimize multiple digital channels campaigns and initiatives including web, mobile, email, social media, consumer relationship marketing, search engine optimization, search engine marketing and digital advertising. being the senior technical resource responsible you will be responsible for architecture and configuration of the marketing technology solution and will act as liaison between the business and technical requirements.
you’ll help organizations improve marketing and customer processes, optimize their data and approach to communications and analytics, and create personalized experiences… the cool stuff in digital marketing. ideal candidates will have experience with marketing cloud and complementary products, leveraging crm systems experience and integration best practices (salesforce, oracle cx, microsoft dynamics), experience with custom and 3rd party integrations, launching audience segmentation and lead scoring programs, and hold expertise in marketing orchestration, automation, data modeling and apis.

roles & responsibilities include: 

technical lead in implementation projects of oracle marketing cloud solutions
run and lead discovery workshops, create user stories, work with product back-log, and ensure clients get high-value implementations
liaise between technical and business domains, ensuring all parties are on the same page, on-board and that all potential pitfalls are covered
work closely with clients to design and execute automated customer journeys, campaigns and nurture programs
develop and execute social media campaigns (facebook, twitter, pinterest, etc.)
be at the fore-front of technology and stay up-to-date with the latest tech and news
work with clients to design and implement actionable measurement tools and kpis - conversion, retention, acquisition costs, etc.
perform demand generation/outsourced marketing tasks on behalf of clients including creation of email/landing pages/templates and web form templates
apply analytics to continually improve demand generation
position yourself as trusted advisor with our clients by showing great ethics, experience and the use of best practice

external posting qualificationsrequired:

strong expertise in marketing automation with several successful projects, performing actual implementations
experience defining marketing strategy and developing and implementing customer journeys and multi-step campaigns
experience designing and implementing lead score models and lead generation program
functional knowledge of digital demand generation, content marketing, social media marketing and email marketing
advanced knowledge of cloud connectors and third party application use and capabilities
reporting and analysis - experienced defining, measuring and reporting on customer engagement metrics and marketing return on investment (roi)
ability to travel to client sites 75-100% of the time.

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

requisition #: j0917-0690 position type: permanent location: 234 laurier avenue west, ottawa, ontario, canada, k1a og9 number of positions: 1 closing date: october 9, 2017 take a central role as canada's central bank, the bank of canada's vision is to be "a leading central bank-dynamic, engaged and trusted-committed to a better canada." no other employer in the country offers you the unique opportunity to work at the very centre of canada's economy, in an organization with significant impact on the economic and financial well-being of all canadians. you will be challenged, energized and motivated to excel in an environment where we are reinventing central banking, renewing ways of doing business and reinforcing a culture of innovation. about the position the canadian economic analysis department (cea) provides high-quality economic analysis, projections and research that contribute primarily to the bank of canada’s monetary policy function. the department conducts longer-term research into issues relevant to monetary policy. cea plays an active role in the communication of monetary policy and as external liaison with the academic community, other central banks, international organizations, canadian businesses and the canadian public. finally, the department disseminates its research at seminars and conferences, as well as through working papers and economic journals.the digital economy and advanced analytics division (deaa) was recently formed to conduct research and analysis related to the digitalization of the canadian economy. the mandate of the division is far reaching, ranging from issues such as the size of the digital economy to the efficacy of big data to improve the bank’s ability to better understand the canadian economy. it will also assist cea with the adoption of new and emerging technologies. your future responsibilities as data scientist, you will participate in data-driven projects and strategic initiatives. you will apply sophisticated machine learning techniques at every stage of data science projects: extraction, cleaning and validation of data, data exploration, design and evaluation of models and, last but not least, communication of results to internal stakeholders. you will use big data technologies to leverage structured and unstructured data from a variety of internal and external sources. you will find creative ways to develop tools and services that drive innovation in cea. you will also• act as a subject matter expert in the areas of data science and big data;• apply, adapt and design computer programs for statistical analysis of data;• leverage theoretical and practical knowledge of advanced analytic methods and algorithms; • provide advice across cea on advanced analytics methodology and tools;• use data visualization techniques to present the results of statistical analyses;• keep current with industry and academic developments;• prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, models and algorithms used and developed;• play a supportive role in economic research projects linked to the digital economy;• perform other operational and processing tasks for the team as required. your education and experience • a completed master’s degree in a technical discipline, such as computer science and mathematics/statistics and two years of recent relevant experienceor• an equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered your knowledge and skills • excellent analytical, research and problem-solving skills, including a high level of initiative;• experience in collecting, organizing and manipulating data, such as national statistics and surveys, with accuracy and attention to detail;• excellent interpersonal skills and ability to clearly communicate information and ideas adapted to the target audience, using clear and compelling written and oral communications;• demonstrated commitment to learning and self-development; • ability to support team members on requests and to provide background and assistance for research and policy initiatives; • ability to organize work effectively, setting priorities to ensure follow-through and project completion in a timely manner;assets • a minor in economics• knowledge of econometrics• experience with visualization software, such as tableau what you can expect from us this is a great opportunity to join a leading organization and be part of a high-performing team. we offer a competitive compensation and benefits package designed to meet your needs at every stage of your life and career.• the salary range at hire for this position is typically from $77,560 to $90,487 (job grade 16), when you meet all qualifications and experience• performance pay for successfully meeting or exceeding expectations (5 to 7% or 10% of your salary, respectively) flexible and comprehensive benefits so you can choose the level of health, dental, disability and life and/or accident insurance coverage that meets your needs• extra vacation days (up to five each year) that you can purchase to add to your vacation entitlement• indexed, defined-benefit pension plan as one of canada’s top 100 employers, we offer you a superior work environment that allows you to reach your full potential both professionally and personally. we make career growth and professional development a priority. we are an equal opportunity employer committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes, and work environments that support a diverse workforce. if you require accommodation measures during any aspect of the recruitment process, we will work with you to address your needs. information related to accommodation measures will be treated as confidential.for more information on key benefits, please visit www.bankofcanada.ca/careers/working-here. additional information • priority will be given to canadian citizens and permanent residents• must be eligible for reliability status • english or french essential• relocation assistance may be provided, if required we wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for this position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. are you interested in this job? copyright © bank of canada addthis sharing sidebarshare to emailemailshare to linkedinlinkedinshare 'canada' application tab - applications on indeed will not be followed up on:https://www.firstderivatives.com/careers/graduates/international/first derivatives (fd) is a leading provider of products and consulting services to some of the world’s largest finance, technology and energy institutions. fd is the developer of the world-leading database technology kdb+. focused on financial institutions that work cross-asset, often with multi-system and/or high volume trading activities, the company scopes, designs, develops, implements and supports a broad range of mission critical data and trading systems across front, middle and back-office operations. the company’s software is also used in a range of industries including telecoms, digital marketing, pharma and utilities to help organisations solve their most demanding data management and analytics challenges.we are currently recruiting for graduates available immediately (october 2017) and in future (january - september 2018). this entry level position on our ‘options’ graduate programme offers candidates a unique opportunity to enter the big data world where the emphasis is on problem solving using a combination of analytics, imagination and business understanding. data scientists explore vast amounts of information to detect patterns, trends and correlations that enable businesses to improve their products, services and revenue.the skills required and the techniques learned apply across various industries and we are heavily involved with financial markets, utilities and telecoms to name but a few. those selected will embark on an exciting career that combines technical prowess with business insight and commercial acumen. candidates will be exposed to the latest technologies for both structured and unstructured data including the market leading kdb+ database and q analytics language, hadoop, sap hana, ios and android all of which are hosted across best-in-class hardware, mobile and cloud based platforms.the initial training will take place in our hq in newry, northern ireland and will last approximately 5 weeks. during this time you will participate in our kdb+ and kx product training and our capital markets training programme (cmtp) simultaneously. after the initial training in hq, employees will be deployed to begin work on exciting projects in some of north america's top financial cities. typical locations include toronto, new york, boston and chicago.on top of a competitive base salary, we provide our employees with a free city-centre apartment and daily expenses (food, groceries, commute to work).the ideal applicant will have:an inquisitive mind-set, an aptitude for problem solving and technical skills to combine theman excellent academic recordrecently graduated (no later than 2015) with a minimum 3.2 gpa in computing, mathematics, statistics, data science, physics, engineering or a similar quantitative disciplineexcellent communication skills to present findings and articulate their business benefitsexperience with java, c/c++ and/or unix is beneficial but not a requirementdue to the travelling nature of this role, candidates must have canadian citizenship or title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, Operations and Schedul...
text:
senior business intelligence analyst, operations and scheduling 










 
back to job listings help 





senior business intelligence analyst, operations and scheduling 






company description
porter airlines has revolutionized short-haul flying with a warm and effortless approach to hospitality, restoring glamour and refinement to air travel. porter is an official 4 star airline® in the world airline star rating®. 

the airline currently offers flights to toronto, ottawa, montreal, quebec city, fredericton, saint john, moncton, halifax, st. john’s, thunder bay, sault ste. marie, sudbury, timmins, north bay, windsor, new york (newark), chicago (midway), boston, washington (dulles) and pittsburgh, and has seasonal flights to mt. tremblant, que., stephenville, n.l., myrtle beach, s.c., burlington, vt., and orlando-melbourne, fla.


job details

function:  
  
the senior business intelligence (bi) analyst, operations and scheduling is responsible for the expansion of porter’s business intelligence (bi) capabilities, maximizing multiple data resources across the airline's' reservations, schedule planning, competitive intelligence, flight tracking, crew planning and financial reporting platforms. 
  
this role must be able to understand airline planning and operational scheduling, particularly around maintenance planning, crew planning and airport gate and turn optimization, to maximize the airline’s schedule completion rate and on-time performance. 
  
the senior bi analyst must have advanced critical thinking capabilities that can be used in data processing, advanced analytics, applied statistics, process optimization, and report prototyping and deployment. 
   
duties and responsibilities:

prototype, deploy and support revenue and customer-related analytics and executive dashboards.
participate in data control and governance, data transformations, the coordination of bi tools with external suppliers, and the gathering of report requirements across the organization.
provide a methodology for marketing campaign assessment and improvement.
assist in the management of company-wide reporting environment, including request intake process, change management and training support.
actively participate in porter’s safety management system (sms) including reporting hazards and incidents encountered in daily operations; understand, comply and promote the company safety policy.

behavioural competencies:


concern for safety: identifying hazardous or potentially hazardous situations and taking appropriate action to maintain a safe environment for self and others.
teamwork: working collaboratively with others to achieve organizational goals.
passenger/customer service: providing service excellence to internal and/or external customers (passengers).
initiative: dealing with situations and issues proactively and persistently, seizing opportunities that arise.
results focus: focusing efforts on achieving high-quality results consistent with the organization’s standards.
fostering communication: listening and communicating openly, honestly, and respectfully with different audiences, promoting dialogue and building consensus. 

qualifications:


5+ years’ experience in the coordination of business intelligence tools; airline experience strongly preferred
a bachelor’s degree required (master’s degree preferred) in engineering, mathematics, computer science or finance
5+ years’ experience in data analysis and reporting tools such as microsoft sql, microsoft excel, alteryx, tableau, crm or similar
passionate about data, analytics and reporting. must be highly proactive, possess advanced problem-solving ability and critical and strategic thinking skills
highly effective project management skills; the ability to participate and lead multiple high-profile projects in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills are a must

   
location:  
  
billy bishop toronto city airport (bbtca)

title: 
                        
sr. manager, global hiring & onboarding experience
                        









 

requisition id: 8225
join the global community of scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
purpose of job:
reporting to the vp, global recruitment, this leadership role is accountable for the development and execution of an awesome candidate hiring experience.  this role identifies potential tools/solutions to enhance an efficient recruitment process, works with program owners to make changes to the existing process and supports the roll-out of a new global recruitment platform to over 50 countries.  additionally, this role measures and reports on the overall effectiveness of the hiring process.
 
this role leads a team of recruitment professionals that are passionate about delivering an excellent experience to all stakeholders in the hiring process.  we have an award winning hiring process and we are looking to make it even better.
 
accountabilities:

develop a global candidate experience strategy; identifying moments of truth, gaps in current process and opportunities for improvement
lead the continuous improvement of a new global hiring process that is currently being implemented across 50+ countries; driving maximum efficiency.
partner with the recruitment technology lead on ongoing global roll-out of successfactors recruitment ensuring alignment of new process and tools to the candidate experience strategy.
identify, develop and implement tool solutions that will continue to enhance the hiring experience for candidates and hiring managers.
optimize current recruitment tools and relationships with third parties to improve the overall efficiency and effectiveness of the hiring process.
lead the development of key metrics to measure the success and efficiency of the new candidate hiring and onboarding experience including leading our candee award initiative.
develop ongoing relationships with global recruitment teams, hr services and other relevant parties to execute processes and maintain recruitment technologies and tools
ensure recruitment processes, policies and tools are aligned with the overall talent strategy and in compliance with regulatory requirements.
provide thought leadership on all aspects of recruitment operations to drive effective usage of tools and program delivery.  recommending innovative and progressive solutions to enhance overall experience.
build a high performing and inclusive team; communicating vison/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team

 
required skills and experience

demonstrated thought-leadership in the identification, development and implementation of leading edge recruitment solutions and tools for a global organization.


deep subject matter and technical recruitment expertise to support a global recruitment team, business hr and other internal stakeholders globally.
strong people leader that is excellent at setting goals, providing feedback and coaching a high performing team.
ability to leverage data from multiple sources to analyze and understand business trends as well as use analytics and insights to influence change.
strong skills in research, writing, editing and project management
fluent spanish, french ideal, but not essential

 
education / experience / other information 

post-secondary degree in human resources or business or related field
3-5 year of previous experience in a global recruitment team required 
demonstrated expertise of global recruitment processes and programs
excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
strong change management and influencing skills
ability to understand organizational needs and develop solutions
ability to communicate with technical and non-technical audiences

location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. we are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

date posted: 
sep 9, 2017
                                

 reference code: 25523-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: toronto, ontario, canada 
all available locations: calgary; toronto 
external posting description 
 
the mergers & acquisitions (m&a) transaction services group is seeking a senior associate, m&a analytics & visualization. this role is critical with respect to providing analytically focused financial due diligence and m&a transaction support to our clients. this individual will play a pivotal role in shaping the visualization capabilities of deloitte’s m&a teams. the ideal candidate for this position will be able to bridge the gap between visualization and financial analysis expertise.
 
as a senior associate or analyst, m&a analytics & visualization you will be required to:
 

quickly develop an understanding of the target business and its drivers
perform interpretation and analysis of information memoranda and business plans
develop static & interactive data visualizations to communicate business insights to clients
build visualizations and supporting analysis of historical trading, quality of earnings, working capital, cash flow, etc.
clearly and effectively communicate requirements, timelines and insights to both internal deloitte team members, as well as clients
collaborate extensively with clients and other deloitte teams
liaise with data science and data architecture teams to optimize client data for visualization and analysis
manage project timelines and client deliverables effectively

 
 
external posting qualifications​​​​​​
 

completed undergraduate degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science or engineering with outstanding academic credentials.
1-5 years of relevant work experience, preferably with a focus on finance/commerce and exposure to data visualization.
finance and/or m&a transaction services experience considered an asset
strong knowledge of tableau, qlikview, power bi, or other bi tools
strong knowledge of sql, powerquery / power pivot, or alteryx an asset
ability to etl client data to facilitate analysis / visualization
ability to manage, analyze and present findings from large volumes of data
knowledge of financial statement analysis (cpa-ca/cfa an asset)
proven analytical skills and systematic problem solving
ability to develop and present new ideas and conceptualize new approaches and solutions
excellent interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to work with others effectively in teams
canadian travel required occasional international travel. candidates must be able to enter the usa to work on client assignments

 
 
 
get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

text:

share this job:





registry support and compliance officer

company:
        rpra
      

location:
      toronto, on
    

type:
      full-time
    

description:
are you a passionate advocate for the environment? do you go out of your way to reduce, reuse, and recycle? do you envision a waste-free future?
if you answered yes to those questions then we’d like to hear from you.
we are the resource productivity and recovery authority (authority) and our vision is: “a waste-free ontario where all resources are reused and recycled. our mission is: “to promote and enforce accountability for the reduction and management of packaging and products.”
our mandate from the government of ontario is to advance a circular economy by supporting the implementation of the government’s strategy for a waste-free ontario: building the circular economy and enforcing the requirements of the resource recovery and circular economy act, 2016 (rrcea) and the waste diversion transition act, 2016 (wdta).
we are looking for smart, talented and committed individuals to join our registry support and compliance team to support the government’s efforts to create a clean and healthy environment for generations to come and to establish a new economy in which all waste is reused, recycled and reintegrated.
as a registry support and compliance officer, your primary responsibilities will include:

ensuring producer performance against objectives set in rrcea regulations by conducting compliance and enforcement activities
ensuring obligated parties comply with current waste diversion program plans and industry stewardship plans under the wdta by conducting compliance and enforcement activities
ensure newly obligated parties comply with registration and reporting requirements under the rrcea by providing support with the authority’s registry system and by conducting compliance and enforcement activities.

in this role, you will perform a range of activities that will allow you to flex both your analytical and customer service skills, and effect positive change in ontario.  
you’re someone who thrives in a dynamic environment. you are detail-oriented. you have an affinity for numbers and data. you can clearly communicate complex ideas. you love digging deep into databases and data models to draw out relevant info and identify larger patterns. above all, you are mission-oriented, compliance-driven, and guided by your commitment to the authority’s legislated mandate.
on a practical level, you will:

assist in the development of annual reporting for current waste diversion programs
develop and execute data quality assurance processes to ensure data consistency, completeness, timeliness, and credibility
analyze complex data sets, translating them into clear and easy to understand reports for key internal and external stakeholders
be a direct line of support to our new registrants, helping them navigate the registry through expert advice and training
deliver a high level of service for registrants to ensure customer satisfaction and ongoing user compliance
ensure compliance by conducting audits and investigating compliance issues
develop relationships with member organizations, municipalities and industry stewards to drive program participation and compliance

data, analytics and reporting will be a big part of being a registry support and compliance officer, but this role is more than just numbers and data. you will be working on the front-lines of a new enforcement and compliance initiative that will require building relationships with producers that will enable us to achieve a waste-free ontario and build a circular economy.
working at the resource productivity and recovery authority
we are a small team and recently formed.  we are in start-up mode operating in an entrepreneurial environment. we are looking for team players who know what all hands on deck means, can hit the ground running, and are ready to make the job their own.
you will be a part of a collaborative team doing ground-breaking and meaningful work with a critical environmental and economic mission.
this is a full-time, permanent position offering a competitive salary between $50,000 – $55,000/ year, commensurate with experience. we also offer generous benefits, a defined contribution pension plan, and 3 weeks of vacation. you will work full-time hours monday to friday.
our office is conveniently located on the yonge subway line at sheppard avenue. if you commute to work via the ttc, we will also provide a monthly metro-pass.
qualifications

experience in data management and analysis
experience with data modelling and forecasting tools, crm software, statistical databases and sql
experience in a customer/client service role is essential
advanced microsoft office skills (word, excel, access, outlook); experience in excel working with advanced functions and formulas, lookups, formatting, databases, mail merge is essential
experience working in a regulatory body doing compliance-related work (e.g. environmental stewardship bodies) is a significant asset
project management experience is an asset
experience working in the non-profit industry is an asset
post-secondary degree/diploma or equivalent work experience (a background in accounting and/or economics is an asset)

how to apply
our online application will allow you to apply for this position as a complete person – not just a resume with key words. the application will assess your qualifications, personality traits and workplace preferences, and should take 10 to 15 minutes to complete. after submitting, you'll receive an email inviting you to log in and view your assessment results.
we value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. if we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us with the “help” button in the application.
we will review applications, with priority given to those who have completed the assessment, and look forward to hearing from you.

deals   job type  full-time   city  on - toronto   job description   collaborate with industry leaders, diverse teams and innovative minds our consulting & deals practice:our extensive selection of services provides businesses with the value they’re looking for. through expert advice and assistance based on our financial, analytical and business process skills, we enhance the performance of companies of all sizes. our clients value our ability to draw on our national and international network of professionals to deliver fast, proven results. pwc’s consultants are business integrators with extensive consulting and industry experience who help our clients solve their complex business issues from strategy through execution. a pwc consulting career may provide the opportunity to grow and contribute in our various competencies that we apply to our clients’ business issues every day. the opportunity: senior associate, information design / data visualization we are seeking an experienced designer (senior associate) to join our growing information design team. information design is best defined as the effective visual representation of complex information so that it can be understood clearly and used to extract value. our team uses information design, data visualization, and structured typography best practices to analyze and interpret data, provide high-level insights, tell compelling stories, develop clear and focused solutions to complex business problems, and communicate key messages on behalf of corporate, institutional, and government clients. we work closely with the other teams within the analytics practice group, as well as technology, the various industry sectors, and the emerging digital practice. requirements: develop static and interactive visualizations from client data to deliver convincing narratives and relevant insights to clients within a variety of industry sectors actively manage design projects and the design/visualization components of larger, multi-disciplinary consulting engagements supervise junior design staff work effectively in multi-disciplinary project teams using collaborative methods emphasizing design thinking rapidly absorb key business issues and develop visual concepts that enhance audience understanding, clarify insights, and identify solutions apply project management skills to balance competing priorities and meet/exceed project deadlines and commitments demonstrate initiative and teamwork through active participation in the coordination of time-sensitive deliverables (in collaboration with project managers, creative directors, marketing managers, editors, and in-house production staff) provide creative and innovative approaches to design while paying outstanding attention to detail and quality under challenging deadlines minimum experience required  minimum of 4 years designing static (infographic) and/or interactive visualizations for client deliverables through the application of information design best practices, preferably in a corporate environment (design portfolio required) minimum of 1 year leading a design or development team proficient in adobe creative suite (indesign, photoshop, illustrator), as well as interactive data visualization tools such as tableau and qlikview familiarity with project management methods, tools, and the application of best practices familiarity with wireframing, rapid prototyping, and iterative development expertise in html5, javascript, d3, and css is highly desirable programming and data skills a bonus ability to work conceptually and solve problems through design thinking strong presentation and communication skills to convey ideas and concepts to various target groups in both business and technology minimum educational experience required  university degree in graphic design or information design, or degree in another discipline (such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering) combined with work experience in information design why work for pwcour employees make an impact with their dedication to client service, creativity, and high performance.  whatever your passion is, the opportunities available to you at pwc will help you realize your career aspirations.   pwc is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of the communities we serve. we encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to ethnicity, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply. pwc: the opportunity of a lifetime    apply to job   save to cart   view similar jobs

title: Data Scientist
text: wish - data scientistdata scientisttoronto, canadaengineering - torontofull-timeapply for this jobdata driven decision-making is an integral part of life at wish. it drives our success with customers and merchants. we’re looking for a talented data scientist to continue to drive decisions company-wide through the use of statistical modeling and machine learning.you should have an extensive background in a quantitative field, a strong research background, and experience working with large data sets. you should be results-driven, highly motivated, and have a track record of using data analytics to drive the understanding, growth, and the success of a product.responsibilities:analyze web scale data to discover patterns and provide actionable insightsresearch and develop statistical learning modelscollaborate with product, engineering and business teams to define and design algorithmic solutionsstay up-to-date with latest technology trends and apply advanced algorithms to improve customer experience and/or increase marketplace efficiencysupport all iterations of data driven product feature development from algorithm design, production implementation to experimentation and measurementrequirements:advanced degree in computer science, electrical engineering or statistics4+ years experience in machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, or a related fieldhands on experience with large scale data processing software and tools (hadoop, spark, mapreduce etc)strong coding experience and knowledge of object oriented programmingexperience in management and a good publication record are a pluscompany descriptionwish brings together top technical talent from google, facebook, linkedin, uber, pinterest, and yahoo! text:

research analyst (contract)

research analyst (contract)
north york, ontario, canada · innovation hub

descriptionmulti-health systems inc. (mhs) is a leading developer of innovative scientific assessments and technology solutions. our assessments are used in a wide range of critical decision-making processes in every type of industry. our clinical tools are trusted to inform psychological diagnoses than can impact prescribed medication, therapy, or treatment programs. in the workplace, mhs talent assessment help inform hiring decisions, develop staff, and improve organization and team dynamics.mhs incorporates our integrity and values into all that we do. since 2013 we have been named one of "canada’s best managed companies". in 2016 we received a "canada's most admired corporate culture award". our employees consistently rank mhs high in employee satisfaction year over year. the mhs team is made up of talented, passionate and creative people who enjoy coming to work. we value diversity, teamwork, trust and open communication. did i mention, we also like to have fun?  overview: we currently have an opening for a research analyst in our innovation hub department. the innovation hub consists of a small internal skunkworks team whose mission it is to explore and develop new approaches and technologies for the assessment of a wide range of psychological phenomena.  our job is to predict trends in assessment and to make sure that mhs is at the leading edge. the research analyst will initially focus on the development of a ground-breaking product for talent assessment. this product will harness our vast library of measurement intellectual property and apply predictive analytics, machine learning and other advanced technologies to enable companies to design and deploy new assessment solutions.  this position requires someone who knows how to perform extensive literature reviews, is passionate about psychology, possesses a strong facility with statistics and quantitative analytics, is driven to learn new things, and has a comfort level with working in a changing environment and is comfortable meeting with high level clients.key areas of responsibility:  conduct      extensive literature reviews within organizational psychology and related      fields, and document findings.   quickly      become familiar with our extensive library of assessment content. perform      descriptive and predictive analytics on large quantities of data and produce      written reports of the results. work      with team members to design and develop online assessment and reporting functionality. write      code in the r language to score assessment results and produce high      quality custom reports to be delivered to test-takers and their managers. deliver      presentations to internal stakeholders and mhs customers. design      and conduct studies to collect data. requirements qualifications & skills:  master’s      degree or ph.d in psychology (industrial/organizational psychology      preferred) or a related discipline with graduate level courses in      psychological research methods and statistics. extensive      experience conducting literature reviews and writing reports. advanced      knowledge of psychometric and statistical techniques (e.g., discriminant      function analysis, regression, confirmatory factor analysis). knowledge      and understanding of test development and validation principles and      practices. proficiency      with statistical software tools, especially the r language.  excellent      writing and editing skills. ability to write compelling and engaging      content for consultants, academics, and business-minded audiences. self-directed      and confident managing own time/schedule in accordance with project      priorities.  experience      with microsoft office applications (outlook, word, excel, powerpoint,      access).  flexibility      required (potential for evening and/or weekend work). some      travel may be required. benefitshealth, dental, extended healthcare, eap, wellness, vacation, personal days

this position is for either an associate or vp level. successful candidate will be responsible for the entire spectrum of quantitative, analytical, technical, and development activities for the fx trading desks. the mandate is to provide traders, marketers, bmo cm senior management and our external control groups (risk reporting, risk oversight, valuation product control, etc.) with the models, tools, analytics, reports, market data and information to effectively price, execute and hedge new transactions and to understand, monitor and manage existing risk.  tasks include:
 
 
 


developing new mathematical and computational methods for pricing deals and managing risk and integrating models into mfl library and fo applications 

maintaining existing suite of fx models in mfl library.

helping traders to use mfl in daily pricing and risk management

interacting with the groups outside of fo (mrv, mr oversight, vpc) and facilitating their understanding and usage of mfl models.

aggregating, organizing and analyzing market and trade data to facilitate a wide range of reporting, from high-level business overviews down to trade-level details.

engaging in discussions with traders, senior management, and risk managers regarding deal modeling and pricing, hedging, risk measurement and risk management.
 
 
 qualifications  
 
 
 
 
 knowledge & skills:

a university degree is required.  preferably, an advanced degree in a technical field (mathematics, physics, statistics, engineering, computer science, etc.);
broad knowledge at an advanced level of quantitative models for stochastic processes and volatility surface.
good understanding of fx products, from linear products to vanilla options, and exotic options.
software development experience (.net, c++);
database experience (sql, oracle);
knowledge of excel, including scripting and efficient spreadsheet design;
experiences in algorithmic trading development and statistical/time series analysis on large data sets are a plus
strong technical writing ability;
strong communication skills, with the ability to deal effectively with a wide range of colleagues.  this includes other technical professionals, traders, marketers, senior management, back office, and risk management. 
 
at bmo we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our dna. for 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. we help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. together we’re changing the way people think about a bank. 
as a member of the bmo team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. we strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. we’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. from in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. 
to find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com. 
bmo is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. by learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

external posting descriptionour analytic team is seeking a consultant who is passionate about using technology, leveraging analytic models and approaches to solve business problems. ideally you will be someone who displays initiative, lateral thinking and have a keen eye for problem solving. your main responsibility would be to position the analytic practice with sas.  support the expansion of the analytic practice in quebec working on analytics and digital strategic advisory mandates and implementation projects
 
in particular you will be involved in :

work in a fast growing, problem solving, innovative, agile and technology enabled environment with like­minded people who are eminent in their respective fields such as analytics strategy, business intelligence, data modeling, agile bi delivery, data management, big data, data visualization, data science and much more
orienting, designing and implementing business intelligence and data warehousing solutions problem solving critical client issues using data to deliver valued results
balancing multiple client projects and other responsibilities
becoming a reference in analytics and information management, particularly in the financial services industry and in the marketing/customer oriented lines of business
participate in building the practice, growing the team and developing eminence communicating effectively to all levels of management

external posting qualifications
1 to 3 years in a business area such as finance, risk/insurance 3 years+ in design analytics and data architectures
highly proficient in sql (or a variant such as t­sql or plsql) programming 3 years+ in implementing sas technology
experienced in other sas solutions including base sas, enterprise miner, visual analytics and other sas technologies would be well regarded
strong understanding of the sas intelligence platform and integration with applications, databases, and service oriented architectures (soap, json, rest)
the capability of quickly, regularly, and independently learning new technologies under the pressure of consistent high­profile project deliverables with review by peers and analytic leaders
strong commitment to professional and client service excellence

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

home   / careers  / data visualization expert

data visualization expert
we are currently looking to hire an expert tableau dashboard developer. the data visualization skills must include tableau software with an understanding of “big data” implications in an enterprise tableau server implementation.
 primary duties of this position include:

use tableau desktop to rapidly generate impactful, interactive visualizations
take the lead on the visual design for all client projects to ensure we are using best practices and that dashboards are as usable, elegant, and attractive as possible
work on their own dashboard projects from start to finish, but will collaborate with other consultants in a dashboard advisory capacity
regularly demonstrate and implement the numerous capabilities of tableau desktop, such as multi-source dashboards, data blending, table calculations, advanced calculated fields, advanced statistical analysis, guided analytics, custom geocoding, etc.
familiarity with visual design best practices and visual cognition concepts

 requirements:

a minimum of 4 years of experience with tableau software
strong executive presence and ability to interact with top executives while retaining an ability to interact with all levels within the organization.
proven knowledge of data visualization best practices and ability create stunning dashboards
knowledge of visual design best practices and visual cognition concepts

visit our website to learn more about what’s happening at unilytics.
to apply for this position, please email resumes to careers@unilytics.com.
we thank you in advance for your application!

text:

about sid lee
sid lee is a leading creative agency with 600 professionals working globally out of offices in montreal, toronto, new york, paris, and la. our multidisciplinary teams leverage the power of radical collaboration to build brands for the modern age, activating communication platforms to engage with today’s consumers across all possible touchpoints. rooted in strategic thinking, our work ranges from advertising to branded content, digital solutions, design & branding, architecture & retail design, social media, experiential platforms & activations, and analytics.
 
by breaking boundaries to create what matters, our company has earned a global reputation as a top-tier brand builder for some of the most progressive clients in the industry. sid lee is also at the origin of c2 montréal, one of the largest innovation events in the world, and is part of kyu, a new collective of creative companies established by hakuhodo dy holdings, the second-largest agency network in asia.
 
unfortunately (or fortunately), talent isn’t the only thing we’re looking for. we also like to surround ourselves with the bold, caring, progressive, and persevering types. you know, the curious ones who take on impossible challenges and see their ideas through to fruition, and the entrepreneurs-at-heart who aren’t afraid of failure. they’re the artisans who make our collective kinder, stronger, and more purposeful.
 
role the account executive works closely with the account supervisor. he/she is responsible for diligently managing projects, timelines, resources and budgets. furthermore, this individual will begin to recognize and articulate creative strategy, from briefing to final delivery. the account executive’s duties extend beyond project management; they are also an important player in terms of creating a fertile environment where ideas can come to life.   create space for the new - demonstrate business category expertise - structure analyses simply and clearly - stay well-informed of marketing and media trends  idea development - recognize good ideas - learn what makes a good, inspiring brief - recognize and articulate the strategic intent of creative - develop basic strategic recommendations - coordinate with strategy in developing work - provide constructive feedback to creatives  communication skills - persuasive - deliver prepared presentations with confidence - confidently discus issues in response to questions  - prepare solid povs on issues related to projects - clearly identify and summarize next steps  get things done - be a team player - master process and production - own budgets and estimates - proactively anticipate and solve problems - rally cross functional teams by keeping them informed and delegating tasks  business results - execute projects - understand how project and budget management impact account/agency profitability - manage projects within timeline and budget  build trusted business relationships - be the executional liaison - manage day-to-day clients - brand manager level+ - earn client's trust and confidence through responsiveness, reliability and know how  internal relationships and people development - you are the "doer" of the account team - establish strong partnerships with internal team to get things done - able to articulate agency culture to new team members   professional skills - analytical spirit and result oriented - delegation skills - thrives is a fast-paced and dynamic work environment - 360° vision of marketing communications - excellent understanding of business and marketing challenges, and knowing how to prioritize and communicate them - excellent understanding of kpis and roi - ability to intervene at strategic moments - excellent relational judgement, both internally and externally - ability to establish and maintain a relationship of trust with clients and act as an expert for all their account service needs  
 
requirements - bachelor’s degree in a related field - experience with (enter mediums they need to be fluent in) - knowledge of (enter specific industries they need prior exposure to) - fluent in english, both spoken and written
